I have hundreds of flights per year every year and since the USAir purchased the failed bankrupt American- I thought American would get better , it appears it has adopted the failed practices that left AA bankrupt and no one cares, the last flight was another incompetent flight waited 3 hours and 45 minutes at the gate on board the plane because the caterer took all 4 trash cans - REALLY! If my job did this continuously we would be out of business , the issue is deeper than just late flights, please call or email me anytime if you want the 300 excuses I have been giving just this past year
title: Scale 1-10 American is still a 1

review: This app is useful, but only if you have perfect network conditions. It is very, very bad at recovering from loss of network (or even going into airplane mode, which you might recognize as use case for literally everyone who flies on an airplane). The app recently refused to update gate information after regaining network connectivity from my last flight. While other apps (and even the mobile boarding pass) had no problems getting updates, even a manual refresh in this app refused to update the info, which I relied on as a source of truth for where my next flight would be. Moral of the story: Don’t rely on this app for up to date flight info, which I would assume is a basic requirement for an app like this.
title: Good in perfect conditions, but very finicky

review: Honestly so glad I downloaded this app - not only does it have all your flight info, gate info, and boarding pass in one place but my flight was cancelled due to weather and it took me less than 5 minutes with this app to rebook instead of talking to customer service. The rebooked flight was definitely not ideal timing but it’s extremely difficult to book a last minute nowadays since every flight is always full and the app made the situation a little more manageable!
title: Download it!

review:
-inaccurate if there’s any flight changes
-doesn’t send you text notifications till way too late
-erases my flight information I enter when I get off the tab, making it ridiculously hard to keep constant track

I flew from California to Michigan and back again with a total of 3 layovers with this airline and this app. It was terrible. Most of my flights were delayed. And every time the app and the screen at the gate didn’t give the accurate information. It would say it was departing on time at 805pm when the time was 810pm. My flight was canceled and I’m waiting in a massive line to rebook. You would think they would be more tech and information savvy at this point in time. Very disappointed.
title: Does Not keep up to date

review: Currently still sitting on a plane in Charlotte, NC.  Should have left at 9:38am.  Sat on the plane at the gate for 30 minutes. Pilot said we were waiting for clearance.  Finally left the gate and went to where the fed ex planes were parked.  Sat there for another hour. Pilot then tells us there is a water pressure issue with the plane and we must return to the gate.  We are now 2 hours on the plane.  We get back to the gate, the pilot tells us the water problem is now fixed but the crew has to be replaced!!! We get off the plane for 20 minutes, then get back on the same plane... with you guessed it... the same crew!!!!!!  The pilot now tells us he will delay our flight another few minutes so they can bring meals on for us to BUY!   Are you kidding me!  3 hours of BS and they want us to purchase meals.
title: Charlotte to Aruba November 9, 2010

review: Just had a 6 hour flight where our middle seat was open in premium economy exit row and the flight attendant decided to move his friend from the back of the plane into our row in the front where we paid extra for the seats (which basically comes with nothing anymore except leg room) Totally unacceptable because this woman did not pay for the seat but we did and should have had an empty seat between since they never sold the seat.  And how about a little more than some stale pretzels and a soda for a 6 hour transcontinental.  Upon landing took 30 min or more for bags, 4 flights assigned on one baggage claim belt.... Get your act together American...  Alaska airlines does it right and you should take a lesson from your newest partner.  A
title: Terrible service

review:
Our flight arrived at 9:48 am from MKE on July 5 at D17 and we are still sitting at baggage claim after 45 minutes. The baggage clerk says that he can’t get the guys downstairs to load the bags.  He is waiting on a phone call and he has escalated his management team. Is this how you treat your loyal customers when you are needing revenue. Not a good experience. Service begins with your lowest paid team member and those are the ones that can make or break you as far as excellence in service. The pilot, agents and flight attendants can all deliver excellence but if the guy handling our personal belongings isn’t doing his best it is an overall “failed” experience!  We have been loyal to AA for years from Executive Platinum to Gold. We expect more from the airline that we love! 
  Jan Franke 
  95E1X86
title: Baggage day

review: Why have an app that one depends on for travel information, but that doesn’t actually provide information? No pop up notifications if there’s a gate change. No pop up notifications when a flight is canceled. You have to actually OPEN the app and get the twirly wheel for it to update and THEN you have your new information. So as a result those early morning flights that get canceled at 10pm the night before aren’t being communicated through the app unless you happen to open the app before you leave at 5am to get to the airport. Who checks email late at night or at 5am? Not those who have late business dinners and then are up at 4am the next morning to catch a flight. So here is the message AA: email is out and texts and apps are in. Use them.
title: No pop ups for flight changes

review:
After asking Jet Blue before leaving my initial flight, if my luggage would automatically get to Madrid or if I had to get it when I got to my connecting flight at JFK, they said that I didn’t have to go to the carousel. They said it would automatically get to Madrid and be on the same flight with me. Once I landed at JFK, I asked the American Airline help desk TWICE if I needed to go get my luggage, they said no, that it would automatically be on the flight with me. 

Welp, after no sleep and landing in Madrid, I have NO LUGGAGE!!! It was left behind at JFK! I have ABSOLUTELY NOTHING TO WEAR!! I’m so upset and angry!!

I was given a toiletry bag for my inconvenience, um thanks? Yeah no, I will definitely be contacting American Airlines once I get to my lodging. This is COMPLETELY UNACCEPTABLE! I kept asking and got reassured THREE TIMES!!
title: Luggage with ALL MY CLOTHES!!

review:
I flew this morning San Jose to DFW AA flight 1019.  On arrival I went to carousel D 31 as directed by the AA app and airport status board. It has been 45 minutes since arrival at the gate. Still no sign of my bag. I waited in line to speak with the baggage service agent. When I was finally able to speak with her she told me to sit tight the bags would be here eventually. She was rude and not helpful at all. I’m still not really sure the status of my bag. They may have arrived at a different carousel but the app and signage still indicates D31 and the AA agent won’t check. I am going to be late for a meeting and I don’t even have an estimate of when my bags will arrive 

 I have logged 3.8 million miles on American. This is another reason that I am thinking of changing airlines
title: Delayed bags with no communication from AA

review:
On July 7th, my 8 year old grandson was flying thru Charlotte to his dads & had an one hour layover.  I live in Charlotte & haven’t seen him for quite some time because of 
 the Pandemic. I drove to the airport hoping to get just a glimpse of him.  Since I didn’t have a ticket,  I didn’t think I would be allowed to go thru security. I asked the gentlemen at the desk if there was any way without a ticket & explained my situation .... yes! American Airlines came thru for this Grandma & he gave me a pass! My Grandson, Josh & I thank you so much! You made our day!❤️
title: Making grandmother’s happy!

review:
Needless distinction between flight credit and trip credit: can’t use trip credit after using flight credit on a flight.  One of my trip credits mysteriously disappeared, and not even the support rep could find it with the number in the email.  Lastly, the “pay by travel credit” functionality is gone for me in the website, so had to call in to pay by flight credit; not even the support knew why it was gone for me at the website.

Overall just seems less well run in terms of IT, process and organization than say United.  Thanks to the above I will have unused trip credit by its expiration. Won’t ever fly AA again.
title: Worst of the big 3 airlines

review:
The AA app team need to get their basics fixed before adding any more gloss.

Infuriatingly if you live in the USA and have a valid US Visa but no Green Card the app will not check you in for international flights...even if you have submitted your valid visa in your AAdvantage account and inputted it into your booking APIS details before checking in. The website, however, can check you in with a US visa if you live in the USA. Seems like the app and web team don’t work as one team and therefore you get a really unaligned customer experience.

Once they can get their basics aligned then the fun stuff like being able to scan and validate your rfid passport etc would be neat. Scanning the passport then to find the app cannot check you in at all is just ridiculous!
title: Great in some places, completely useless in others

review: This app is dated and terrible- it doesn’t load correctly freezes etc.  this morning I tried to check in and it kept timing out even tho my phone is fine and WiFi is on.  Last time I took a flight with American I planned on just using the app for my mobile ticket.  I waited in the security line for 30 mins got to the front to tell me that my information was incorrect (the app did not refresh my ticket info) and security could not process it. They sent me out the the kiosk to print a paper ticket so I could get thru security. Apparently this is a huge problem with the app and happens to many people.  It’s pointless if u still have to sign in at the kiosk.  I used to like American but due to the dated nature of the app and me almost missing my flight I grown weary of their crap.
title: Worst app ever

review: Had to book a last minute flight for a family emergency early tomorrow morning and when I went to sign up for the rewards program, it told me a valid phone number contains 10 numbers. I tried to enter it a couple times (double checking each time), but it wouldn’t accept it. Phone reset + uninstalling the app etc did nothing. I had to book the flight as a guest and although the app said my flight is booked, I haven’t had my credit card charged and have not received an email and it’s been half an hour. I’m worried I won’t have proof of my flight being booked, or worse and have it not booked.
title: Won’t accept phone number when signing up

review: As a corporate traveler and platinum pro member, I was extremely disappointed to find that after a recent update I’m now unable to login to the app. The AA app has worked fine for years of corp travel for me, but I noticed recently the app will no longer let me log in. I used my computer and reset the password thinking something may have happened, but to no avail... I still can’t use the app. This means the app is now completely useless. I almost exclusively did mobile checkin and mobile boarding passes, and with the loss of this app, I am now forced to use kiosks, waste time, and waste paper boarding passes. This is a HUGE hassle for an experienced traveler. AA better get their crap together with this app.
title: Unable to log-in after recent update

review:
Coming from another major airline with a great app, I can solidly say the American Airlines app is noticeably sub-par. It’s missing all kinds of information and functionality to make your travel experience smooth.

Things missing:
1. Trip duration - want to know how long you’ll be in that metal tube so you can make better food/entertainment choices? Too bad! The app doesn’t tell you that.
2. Seat maps - want to know if that seat next to you is open or where the heck your seat actually is on the plane? Nope. You can’t.
3. Mileage accrual - want to know how many miles (EQMs) you’re earning for your current flight? Sorry!
4. Aircraft location - sometimes you can see information concerning your arrival aircraft. Most of the time you can’t. Unclear why this information can’t be available consistently.

While there is a lot to complain about concerning this app, the designers got a few things right:
1. Home screen provides useful information the day of flight
2. Track your bags is well integrated
3. Each flight instance being a “card” and swiping through them works well.
title: Solidly Sub-par

review:
Do not pay any attention or place trust in the AA app or text messaging service on time changes for flights. We placed trust and dependability on their communication services and needless to say the gate shifted the departure time to the left. This caused us to miss our flight because we never received any further updates via phone. 

Also, the gate agent did not provide us an explanation to the time changes and their costumer service rep failed to provide us with solutions/recommendations. Instead, he argued and said we should always check in with the gate agent, for any flight, which I don’t think is realistic for any customer. 

Anyway, best of luck to AA. I will no longer be purchasing tickets through you in the future.
title: Distrust in communications department

review:
I was honestly surprised to see the AA app with such low ratings. 

As an AAdvantage member, I rely on this app to book flights, keep records, track my luggage & family’s flights, etc. The app is always sending me push notifications about gate numbers and check in times the day-of my flight (or the night before when I fly early). When I book through 3rd parties, my flight information is transferred over. The app is easy to navigate and provides plenty of information regarding your flight and the airports you’ll fly in and out of.

However, I rarely fly United or Delta, so I cannot speak about their respective apps. 

Reading the reviews, it seems like the majority of the people have issues with the airline itself, hoping that the app will solve all their travel problems. Unfortunately travel apps don’t have control of weather/travel delays, lost luggage, or who is/isn’t upgraded (yet).
title: Reliable app!

review: Doug who worked at the AA customer service desk in Tampa was very helpful. I was late and missed my flight because of a personal emergency and had to make other flight arrangements and he was very accommodating and ended up finding me a better flight that was nonstop to my destination instead of arriving later and having to take a connecting flight as originally planned. He made a stressful situation so much better and this is the reason I will always fly American Airlines. Thank you!
title: Customer service

review:
This app used to be ok, now it’s gotten less than ok.  Twice within two months I’ve had to uninstall/re-install this app to get it to work like it normally should!!! Just today was trying to retrieve my boarding pass and could get the menu to pop-up to add/review in Apple Wallet. (Side note — I HATE being forced to view the boarding pass in Apple Wallet.  I never use that app and would prefer to just open the boarding pass in the American app!!!)

The first time I had to uninstall/re-install was because when paying for my checked bag I could scan my card with my camera and it would take the information, but then I wouldn’t have any kind of “confirm” button to save the information into the fields to continue with my payment...so I was having to enter my information manually!!! 😡

Where is the QC on this American?!

And one more thing...WHY THE HECK AM I PAYING FOR MY BAGS AND CHECKING IN ON THE APP IF I STILL HAVE TO USE THE KIOSK AND TAG MY IWN BAG MYSELF??!!! 

Take a lesson from Delta...if I do everything in the app, all I should have to do is drop my bag off at the counter and head to security!  MAKE IT EASY for customers to do business with you!
title: Charles Barkley Turrrible!!!!

review: I like the app. It has everything I need in it and is easy to navigate. It was very easy to change flights when I needed to. When one of my flights was delayed, making me miss my connection, I didn’t have to wait in line at the service desk. American had already saved me a seat on the next flight and all I had to do was confirm it in my app. I got an alert that another flight was delayed and I just changed it in the app. I gave it 4 stars because it seems they could combine some info into one location in the app, but it was totally easy to use.
title: I don’t understand the bad reviews.

review:
On my last couple flights from
Hawaii to the mainland, I couldn’t watch in-flight movies on American Airlines. I used to watch movies in flight on my phone.  My IOS is updated and the app is updated as well.   The Wi-Fi AA in-flight option gave me an error that it couldn’t support the certificates, but the app loaded all the movies and TV shows but would never start when I pushed the play button. I tried every option, changing the settings multiple times but never got past the play arrow button. My sister also claimed she had the same issue when flying with American.  This is unfortunate especially when traveling long distance.
title: Inflight Entertainment

review:
I am an AAdvantage member for over 20 years.  And am being discouraged by this App.  It does not refresh when you open it.  The information on your flight can be months old and totally incorrect.  Currently we have flights booked but are on separate Locaters.  One person received an email changing the flight and seat.  I went to the App and nothing was changed.  No text or email came to me either.  I realized it did NOT refresh!  Once I did that it updated.  
Had someone else no told me of the change I could have missed the flight and worse would have to ague for a refund/credit towards another flight. 
AA-  please assign someone to update this App!
title: You are at Risk if you don’t Refresh the App Often!

review:
I like the design and layout of the app but as I’m
Learning it I didn’t find it that intuitive to see my departing and returning flights. I had to click into the first trip to see the 2nd trip. Wouldn’t have been able to figure that out immediately. Took me some time. 

I also didn’t know how I could add a flight before takeoff to my account that way to accumulate
Points. I am a loyal Delta Skymiles member but due to my airport may have to take American more. So I think it’s important to be sure that it’s clear how to do that
title: Design and Layout of Application

review: I’ve used this app for a few trips. Yesterday, during a chaotic day of weather impeded travel, this app really came through. Not only did it keep me updated about the status of AA flights, but it notified me when my travel office booked me an alternate flight on another airline, provided the information for the new itinerary, and then did a better job of tracking the new flights than the other airline’s app. Boarding passes, updates, and bag tracking also works without issue. This app really helps
title: Excellent App

review: My flight was unexpectedly cancelled(4 hours before departure and I still never found out why), and after 45 mins of being on hold I was able to reschedule my flight to the next morning, however I never got a confirmation email and the app kept glitching up and would only show information for my CANCELLED flight not my new/rescheduled one, it caused SO much stress and confusion due to so many errors and lack of organization on their end. Not to mention the map told me to go to the south terminal instead of the main one and I almost missed my luggage check in time because of that. I hope I never have to fly American Airlines again and use this stupid app, that barely works.
title: Cancelled flight and app wouldn’t update

review:
I flew from Hawaii to Charlotte    I tried to upgrade to first class.  A disaster at the check in.   Employee could not process request.  After 45 I gave up and kept what I had.    However that would not work a d they took ten more minutes putting it back to what it was

Terrible idea on my part to try in person.  Will go with 1-800 number exclusively on all changes.  Which. Did have. 3 hour wait and call back

Other than that the flight and service was great
title: Good and bad

review:
I just completed AA 2424 from DFW to LAX.
Seat was changed from 13B next to my wife in 13A to 15B.
I had people in all the seats around me.
No social distancing at all.
Before takeoff, I asked the male flight attendant, which had no name tag, if I could move to one of the open seats in exit row 16 or 17. I was told if I was not comfortable, I could take a later flight. Really?
He also said people pay extra for the exit row seats, which flew empty the whole flight.
Really?
And I am Platinum and would not have had to pay extra anyway.

This is a poor performance as far as social distancing and customer service.
I video recorded most of the filled seats and empty seats. I may turn it over to the DFW media to share.
I want an explanation for changing my seat and risking my life in the middle seat within9 other people.
Please advise 

Greg
title: Social distancing not practiced by American Airlines

review:
With the recent update to iOS and the app, there seems to be an issue with the mobile boarding pass. Despite of getting the mobile pass in the wallet app and having all settings related to showing pass on lock screen and location access to aa app and wallet app turned on, the boarding pass has stopped showing up in the lock screen. 

Also, long standing complaint with the aa boarding pass is still not resolved. All other airlines shoe the boarding time in the boarding pass. No, aa can’t make your life simple with such a small convenience. They want you to login to their app and look at your trip to figure out the boarding time!
title: Boarding pass functionally is broken

review: Tried to check in a week ago.  Had all the correct info, but it didn’t recognize it.  Call the phone number late, told it will be an hour wait.  Total butthead answers and says it’s because I bought ticket through Expedia, then says he will transfer me to tech support.  That puts me in que for another one hour wait.  Now another hour get call back better person gets it fixed.  Now return flight won’t let me check in.  Back to one hour wait (57 minutes this time). To add insult to injury, when you call it says your phone number is recognized and tells you when your reservation is, DUH! That’s why I’m calling, I just want to check in. Find another airline, this one doesn’t care about customers at all!!
title: Total trash, find another airline

review:
Inefficient, disrespectful, always late. Those are just some of the adjectives you can use to describe this awful airline. The fact that they have American in their name just disgraces the country in general. Time and time again when we had needed to fly with them because there was no other airline flying o our destination. We experienced long layovers and abrupt cancellations. For example, We had a Noon flight to Dallas, Texas and we got there expecting to leave at 7:30 to Santa Fe, New Mexico. It’s now 10:30 and we don’t have an answer. And don’t even get me started on the customer service. Rude, they you as a child and there is no repercussions about the poor work ethic 

One star is one too many.
title: The worst airline in the world.

review: I bought an air pass business class ticket and flew today on JFK-SFO flt 179. I was seated next to a man with a baby. He allowed the baby to crawl and walk all over the aisle in business class. The baby cried,vomited etc the entire flight. While this is no responsibility of AA, I saw that first class was more than half empty. The flight crew saw the distress I was in as well as the other person in our row and at no point offered to move us up. This would have been a logical customer service move. The flight crew also never said a word to the man but then Joked about how awful it was as we were disembarking. I think they have a responsibility to keep some order especially in the front of the plane.
title: Terrible flight

review: This is the first time I’ve ever felt compelled to write a review for a travel app like this because of how helpful it is. Easy to see your flights, check in and get boarding pass. Tells you what gate you’re at and gives you maps of how to get there. Gives real time updates when flight times change. Can track your bag and make sure it was loaded and unloaded at different stops. All around really useful and functional
title: Great App and Actually Helps

review: The features of the app are really nice (when the app works). It’s great being able to have my boarding pass as well as all my flight information on my phone. I fly American frequently, so I’m always using the app to book and check flights. The app crashes every other time I use it, and when it’s crashing, it keeps crashing. It’s very annoying when I’m trying to check information about my upcoming flights and every time I hit a certain button, the app crashes. This could be a really good travel app, but instead - as a result of only working half (or less) of the time - it’s only OK.
title: Could be better...

review: The most basic function of the AA app is to provide accurate, up to date flight info. This is a systemic problem and makes the app of limited use. Several examples: I was on an AA flight operated by British Aerospace. The flight was delayed by two hours. The app showed it on time, and then showed the aircraft departed while we had not yet boarded. A similar issue happened again today. The app did not indicate that it could not retrieve information or TBD, but rather continues to display erroneous information. Other travel apps are receiving updated flight data so there is no excuse for the AA app to not work properly. If it is not capable of providing this information accurately, it’s not possible to trust it on other low priority information. BEWARE!
title: Accuracy missing

review: I flew international, when I arrived my luggage was nowhere to be found so I put a claim in. Once I made it back to the states I put in yet another claim and was told to call they would get back to me soon. Soon never came, so after 2 weeks of calling them and never getting a complete answer the service office finally stated I would have to wait 45 days out from contacting them (which was now 2 weeks that my luggage is still lost) and if not found they would proceed with POTENTIALLY being able to refund me of my items. I am now 28 days out from having my belongings with no call or email of any type of update. Never flying American again. Terrible way of handling things.
title: Never flying American again

review: I’ve been using the app for quite a while and find it to be really very useful and reliable for many things. The only issue that I have is with its integration into in flight entertainment. It has to open the browser to select a video and then get an option to play in the app. Very awkward, if it works. It used to work on my iPad and iPhone but now only works on the phone. The iPad won’t open the browse properly. iPad and phone are running the latest iOS and I’m running the latest version of the app on both.
title: Good for most things

review: As a former Chairman’s Preferred on US Air, I’m appalled by the outrageous escalation of prices in certain routes since the merger. Service on flights is generally poor as is the condition and cleanliness of planes. Only with aa do I need to pay close to $700 for a 45 minute round trip and am not even entitled to select a seat, and have to endure the multiple chastising about how my fare entitles me to nothing, but if I fork over more money, I may have a better flight experience. Who thought that was a great idea after taking a chunk of my money?  I’d suggest aa try a different approach for extorting more fees from their customers. Have gladly given up the status I had to fly other airlines when I can.
title: The app is the least of aa’s issues.

review: This is what I like to call a beautiful terrible experience. Your app is visually stunning with some great interactive elements and features, but it fails to do the simple things users need the most. You need to better integrate your app with wallet apps. Allow copy/paste for record numbers. I love what you’ve done with the home screen/pull up drawer mechanic, but only utilizing that space for a credit card ad is a huge missed opportunity. Look at your data and see what users are using your app for the most and put that in the home area, and keep your credit card ad under that. Small steps like this can lead you to a huge improvement on an already visually mature app!
title: Needs better UX

review:
Many features work well on this app, but it won’t let me view my boarding pass. It works fine for my husband, but didn’t work on my last phone, doesn’t work even when deleted and reinstalled on this phone. 

When I click on boarding pass I get a blank screen titled “passengers”. I can see the list of passengers for an instant when I go back but can’t check off whose boarding pass I want. If I add my boarding pass to wallet through an e-mail it then works fine. I fly about 6-8 times per year and always have this problem.
title: Can’t get boarding pass

review:
Honestly, I would give this app a solid 4-5 stars if not for the fact I have used Delta’s and United’s applications.  
For the frequent/business traveler this app excels at giving you a lot of what you didn’t ask for (Good food in LAX?) and none of what you did (Like in app receipts/purchases and a transparent look at upgrades and status).  
AA is the largest airline on earth, it kind of seems inexcusable that they are routinely behind on what would seem to be basic in app needs. 

There are good things, but it’s kind of mind boggling that they don’t go the extra mile.
title: Cumbersome and very much behind others

review: The culture of this company is in desperate need of change (this is directed primarily at the gate agents).  They are less than helpful or accommodating especially when flights are delayed. In this particular case they shut the door so they could have an “on time departure” only to have a sit on the tarmac for almost 30 minutes while the rest of our group was left behind due to their AA connecting flight being delayed.  They ran up to the gate as the agent was closing the door and she would not open the door.  We sat there talking to them on the phone as they watched us and no one would bother to help.  I e always had good service in the air but the gate agents are pulling the company down.
title: App is ok… AA as a company not so much

review: Disappointed to say the least! I paid more for this ticket than any other trip to Mexico and had delays on both legs of the flight and my luggage didn’t arrive with me. Then I was supposed to get a call when they located my luggage, no one called and I got no reassurance that it would be delivered so she suggested if it were urgent that I just come pick it up. I was looking for assurance that it would be there since I would have to pay for parking to retrieve it and all she would say is “that’s the plan” and I paid an extra $30 for the bag and never offered a refund for at least that part. Had to purchase items to get thru the day and pay for parking and no apology? Wow just “thanks for flying American”. Not sure I’ll do that ever again:(
title: Not a fan

review: This isn’t rocket science. Fix the international checkin with passport expiration date allowed to be entered with diverting to current date. Allow checkin with bags to be seamless. Maybe check out other airlines that are successful and make the app that simple. This shouldn’t be difficult either for partners airlines booked. I should be able to enter minimal info such as last name and booking locator or whatever you call it ( be consistent) and it should pull up. Not all of this other nonsense as it’s all i your computers. I should only have to enter info such as passport once and it should carry over! Really not that hard as other airlines do it.
title: Fix it International

review: Took a simple trip recently and this app was basically worthless. Couldn’t use it to check in for the flight (I looked in vain for any button or link for 20 minutes, then gave up and used TripIt to check in). Couldn’t use it to add a checked bag. Tried to use it to change seats but only worked half the time. After I checked in using the kiosk, the e-boarding passes became available but can only be viewed in Apple Wallet, not in the app itself. One flight was delayed but the info wasn’t updated for almost an hour after the original takeoff time.  Compared to the excellent Delta app, this is garbage.
title: Surprisingly bad

review: This is a horrible app! Me and my sister we’re looking for the entertainment finally when I go to pull the sidebar and it says entertainment. I press the entertainment button and it does not work! After that my sister went on the website????What freaking website, then we see these movies pop up! But then we notice that there trailers not movies!After that the freaking announcement guy says that movies are money on credit cards! There is not even a lot of choices it’s like 3 movies! I was not going to spend 30$ on a movie that I did not want to watch!So my sister and I are like screw it! After all of this the also takes up my data! Definitely not worth it! I almost screamed at my phone because it was so frustrating!
title: Horrible app

review: Why does American always have so much trouble handling my golf clubs?  Lose them, miss putting them on flights (even without connections), failure to deliver from the back claiming they must have fallen off the cart/belt, and etc.  It is like a never-ending script that repeats itself time and time again.  Also, why do I have to be told to wear my mask 7 times before takeoff between the flight attendant announcement, the copilot announcement, the pilot, the safety recording…but I’m only told to ensure To fasten my seatbelt one time.  We have lost our perspective on what is important from a safety perspective.  And yes, here I sit still just waiting for my golf clubs over an hour after landing…again.  I wonder what the story is this time.
title: Baggage

review:
Two biggest gripes: 
Calendar entries are not itinerary-aware. What I mean is if I am booking a flight with a layover, the address on the second flight is my layover airport instead of the destination airport, which would make more sense. Sounds small, but when your calendar is shared with your spouse, who is picking you up, it’s hard for a “time to leave” alert to be accurate if it’s tied to the wrong address (i.e., the layover airport). Second, the bag tracker requires me to search for my confirmation number or bag tag every time I want to check on my bag. Kind of annoying.
title: Decent, but could be better

review: This app is great...when it works. I just had to delete and re-download the app (the 3rd time in just over a year).  I do like the features...mobile tix, in-flight entertainment, airport maps, flight checks, etc.  But the glitches are annoying.  I am not a freq flier; so, I I give it 3 stars.  If I flew more often and had the glitch frequency as often, it may have been less.  For me, it is more of a nuisance or irritation than a problem.  But...on the other hand, it isn’t receiving four stars b/c it seems I have to delete and re-download the app every time I fly (2-3 times per year).  And yes...I do update phone regularly.
title: Glitch prone

review:
When using the Apple Watch app and flung multi segment flights, the app almost universally tells me the status of the first flight, when it will land at its next destination, etc.

Would be nice if the main display showed the next flight info after the plane lands as it does with the first flight.  Been it’s behavior for years and does not seem too useful to report on the plane you got off.  

Note if you open the status within the app, it usually gets you the right info, but not without touching the display.
title: Apple each improvement request

review: I usually don’t leave reviews on apps, but this one is pretty bad. Bugs everywhere.  It’s impossible to create an account since the registration form has fields that will not validate no matter what.  When using the guest feature to search for trips you can’t even put content in some of the fields.  As someone who works in the web development field, it’s pretty obvious they have a team developing the app who is novice at beast.  Certain core functionalities of this app just don’t work.  Things like this should never make it past QA.   They could probably hire a freelancer that understand making apps to improve this app tremendously.   You are a multimillion dollar company; there is really no excuse for an app this bad.
title: So bad had to leave a review

review:
Flight 1523 from Miami to Detroit was cancelled due to toilet malfunction. Flight was overbooked although I had guaranteed seat.   When the cancellation occurred the desk attendant put his hands in face and pointed in 2 directions to rebooking desk.  Everyone went running in different directions.   Horrible scene.  I was lucky due to being solo traveler to get on a flight was promised a food voucher - never received - ghosted at airport.  Given horrible and conflicting instructions on gate number.   I will not fly AA again just due to complete incompetence.   I gave one star due to my luggage making it to DTW AFTER it arrived on a different flight and an hour and half wait for that plane to arrive. 
#delta4life
title: Poor customer service.  Never again

review:
I cannot imagine how frustrating it must be for the developers of this app. The app itself performs fine but the overall value lies in the data. In the case of an airline, the data resides in numerous platforms, often managed by departments that are far too autonomous. This forces the developers to mask the data to appear as a unified source. Kudos to them for that effort.

Seems like AA could learn a thing or two from competitors like Southwest and others with apps that are far more useful with reliable, up-to-date information that’s easy to access.
title: Much Room for Improvement

review:
My husband and I are retired and we love to travel..the only thing that makes me want to stop traveling is that you allow dogs..every time we fly I have to take allergy meds..when did dogs become more important than humans? I don’t understand how our country of freedom of humans! Became freedom of animals ..I feel like my human rights are insignificant..it’s become a dogs world,  with out the thought or concern of the people who live here..
It’s sad that we have to be concerned with animals when we fly...
Upset
JOANN ROSNER
title: So disappointed

review:
This app is almost useless to me.  It does not make my life easier as it steals time away from my day. 

I am already logged in and it knows who I am, yet I have to dig out my record locator for each flight to find my flight times and move to any next step. If I have to look up my record locator in a different location, that location already has the flight times, so why do I need this app? In contrast, the Emirates app already has everything I need ready to go without me having to find some random un-rememberable record locator. 

The AA app main page has my elite status, a note about Covid that should be able to be closed, and an advertisement for the AA credit card.  I would much rather see my flight itineraries, as this is why I open the app in the first place. Please focus on service to the customer. This is what maintains loyalty. The advertisements take it away.  

Fix this please. If it’s already “fixed” it’s not obvious how the app works so it still gets one star. Fix it.
title: Why a record locator? You already know who I am.

review: We were suppose to take off at 11:47 am and then we had 2 mechanic issues so when we got off the lady at the gate told us all our plane would leave at gate bravo 14 we were all at E29. When we got to B14 the lady came over the intercom saying we were suppose to be at E14. My app never updated telling me that so we all had to run back because they were calling for last call to board. The lady at E14 didn’t care that we were told wrong and was very rude to all of use that literally ran back to catch this flight. I wish my app told me the new gate then walking all the way from E to B then B to E to catch a flight that was about to leave us.
title: Does not update the flight info

review: Flight was great but was not thrilled when there was someone in my seat in 3F when I boarded. The flight attendant said something about having to shuffle people because someone had to sit with her nurse. Fortunately 3A was open so I sat there, unfortunately there was a lady behind me who was hacking her lungs up the whole flight. I didn’t appreciate that considering I was supposed to be sitting across the isle. Why not put the random person who was in the seat I paid for in the seat that wasn’t assigned to anyone??
title: Flight 638

review: This app is so bad.. Network issues preventing me from accessing my boarding pass at the airport which is very frustrating. Additionally, when booking a flight the app coding is messed up which prevents me from scrolling all the way down to click next on a page which requires me to access from a website instead of app to book the trip. Please hire people that know how to properly build an app!
title: Horrible app

review: Kudos to the developers.  The American app is fantastic and I hope this high caliber of quality remains consistent.  It works perfectly with ios14 and there is no delay with any functions.  I really really loved the integration with the iPhone and the push notifications received that are relevant and timely (Ie: flight connection gate and time).  Other delights are seat selection, looking up/booking flights, making changes to flights...so good! Super impressive job American!!
title: I’m loving this app!!

review:
The AA is super helpful and handy for checking flights, alerts, Admirals Club locations, walking directions between gates, etc. 

The only reason the app didn’t get 5 stars from me is because it CONSTANTLY sends calendar updates saying flight times or locations have changed even though nothing has changed! It seems every single time the app is opened (which sometimes is often bc I’m a frequent flyer on AA), I’ll then have new calendar updates for every upcoming segment. It’s driving me nuts! Pleeeease provide a fix for this!
title: Helpful but ithere’s an annoying glitch!

review: I love the app and the conveniences of knowing where your bag is coming out, etc. but I find the entertainment part frustrating and spotty. The inflight Wi-Fi takes a long time to come on and kicks you off mid flight. I need up spending more time trying to reconnect and get the movie back to where I was than watching it. Otherwise—appreciate the effort and the continual improvements and conveniences. Thank you!
title: Love the app—getting entertainment can be rough

review: Don’t waste your time with American Airlines period. This is my first ad last experience with them. The app is crazy slow. It failed to do multiple simple tasks and I had to close out the app and restart again. Plus, they want to charge you for every little thing which is crazy! They try to make you pay for your luggage in the app which is stupid expensive for one bag. It took me over 15 minutes to check in on the app. Every other airline I have used (United, delta, and southwest) were all easier and more friendly to check in and arrange your bags for the flight. Do not waste your time with American or their crappy app! I hope my flights are better than the check in experience.
title: Terrible App!!

review: Being Executive Platinum which I have been for almost 5 years , I have really noticed an improvement in the service I get. I really appreciate it. My travel should pick up in the years to come and I will be responsible for my teams travel. The one thing I wish is that I would be invited to be in concierge key. I’m almost at 2 million miles and fly 150 to 200k and have 24 people I’m now responsible for their travel. Thanks.
title: Nice being treated well.

review:
After waiting till no one around the baggage belt at 6:30pm Nov15, I was told that my luggage was not in my flight, AA1992 from DFW to SEA.  What made me even more mad is AA’s arrogance: either waiting for another 5 hours in SEA airport to get my luggage, or waiting for being delivered till next day with no specific timeline. Both options are bad. I was forced to go with anxiety and crossed my fingers to wait the baggage to come tomorrow. All my schedule is messed. 

My daily stuff and my coat are in the luggage. Now Seattle is 46 degree. I am cold. I am disappointed. I am angry. 

This is not the way to do business, American airline! You should respect your customers, you should compensate my suffering!
title: Luggage missed my flight

review: Totally messed up our return reservation. Had one of us coming home June 3 and another June 7. When we found the mistake, their solution was to put one of us on a plane the next day. No offer to pay for extra hotel night, extra day of car rental, missed work.  Or one of us leaves reAlly early on an indirect flight. Leaves Phoenix at 9:15 am (which means we lose the day of vacation) flies to Philly then Detroit arriving at 7:30 pm and then waits 3 hours for the other to come on the direct flight that we we’re supposed to both be on together.  If we want a refund or consideration for all the problems thenwe have to email, not allowed to talk to someone about it.
title: Reservation error

review:
When this app first launched there was a lot of things to be added. Over the last year they have improved it exponentially! I have all the airline apps and this is hands down the best airline app! Love that I can book with miles now. Easy to track luggage and navigate through airports!  Checking in and upgrading made easy! 

Thank you AA for updating and making the changes recommended by us users/customers!
title: Started off needing a lot but now this app does it all!!

review: Absolutely trash airline, trash system, trash app, had terrible experience with them... supposed to leave 30th flight got canceled, supposed to leave 31st flight got canceled, rescheduled on another airline, didn’t even send the tickets through, had to call back American Trash Airlines and twice and get them to send the tickets through, trash attitude with person on the phone, trash over priced trash planes, no room for over head bins ever, over priced seat changes, trash service and options on planes, app doesn’t load current tickets, kept old tickets and old bookings, trash company, probably a good short on the stock market, good luck dealing with these clowns you’d have better luck at the circus.
title: If I could give zero stars I would

review: The app is actually great with good transitions, fluid viewcontrollers and compatibility with wallet and other apps. Not sure about all of the negative reviews but I’ve been using American (the app) since it came out and it’s gotten so much better. In fact one of the benefits of this app is that the staff recognizes it as a tool while other airlines have no clue how to integrate their apps at the gate. There have been a whole heap of issues with American (the airline) but I’ll reserve that negative review for another place. The app is good!
title: Bad Rep Perhaps?

review: To check in, I had to download another app which already confounded me in order to verify my Covid-19 vaccination. That itself took over an hour as you have to wait for someone to check it. Afterwards, the American Airlines app itself made me go through multiple steps requiring passport information that not only seemed redundant, but asked for scanning in some places, and then would not let me check in for multiple attempts. Still functional but a lot of hassle for just checking in.
title: Pretty time consuming versus any other airline app

review: We paid for our bags to be checked on the app and when we tried checking them in they told us we hadn’t paid for them even after I showed them my bank statement for it. So instead of paying $60 for two bags we ended up paying 120. The lady was so rude too! Also! On the app it says they’ll try to sit you with your party if it’s possible but they separated my husband even though they could have sat us next to each other.  They try to get as much money out of the customers. To our luck The people sitting next to us where with each other so we were able to swap seats. Shame on you American Airlines. I had higher expectations
title: Thumbs down.

review: As a very heavy traveler (several weeks per month) I use nearly every airline app. Many of them have their issues, and in comparison I find the American Airlines app to be quite reliable and useful. The most recent version in particular offers many of the capabilities of the website and is the primary way I interact with AA now. I’m sure there are improvements that can be made but for me this app works great in terms of needed services, design, and availability.
title: Works well for frequent traveler

review: Won’t let me download or print a boarding pass for my flight tomorrow morning. Forcing me to go to kiosk to print boarding pass and won’t even tell me seat assignment, telling me to go see agent at gate for my seating assignment. So far I’ve had a terrible experience with AA. Was on the phone for 30 minutes with AA customer service trying to get a boarding pass, paying extra for seats in order to get boarding passes, for her to tell me that I actually won’t be able to receive a boarding pass and must arrive early at the airport to print it. Terrible customer service and help and terrible experience with American.
title: Terrible accessibility and customer service

review:
Unacceptable service. Cancel flight 12 hours prior to departure ECP to DFW. On rebooked flight, sit on the ramp at DFW for a gate marshaling crew for 20 min. Run to DFW-SAT flight to have a mechanical. I could put up with and understand until this point. Then send entire DFW-SAT flight to DFW gate A10. Then told our flight is not here, it is DFW to Omaha. Gate agent and CSR have no update. Now American App states A10 with a 1 hour late departure and a 1330 take off. But Omaha is still on the gate and agent is unsure what gate we should be at. 

If this is new American Airlines, then you have a problem. My AA frequent flyer info 52rlk74. Since my wife on another AA flight from ROC to SAT will be sitting in the SAT terminal for hours, I would like a response.
title: Not American Airlines standard

review: Disappointing level of service on my most recent flight from Dallas to El Paso- which will be the final time I let American frustrate my travel plans. The attendants were wasting lots of time manually counting customers, to the point where the attendants were arguing about the number of customers on board the flight. This is the only airline with whom I’ve flown that seems to struggle with elementary counting skills. Add to that a frustrating interface on this app and higher than average delays and bad customer service interactions. I’m no flight attendant, but by my math, that all adds up to a BAD company. Spend the extra money, fly Delta or United and thank yourself for avoiding American.
title: App and service close to the worst in the industry

review: On our return flight from Denver, my wife and I were assigned seats together.  By the time we arrived at the Denver Airport, our seats were reassigned and we were no longer sitting together.  Although she was busy, the gate took a minute, stopped trying figure out why it happened, and worked it out to where my wife and were able to sit together.  This was awesome customer service!  Thank you.
title: Excellent Customer Service

review:
Since there is no way to rate the airline I guess I’ll use the app rating option to get myself heard. 
I have had nothing but bad experiences with American Airlines. Late flights, rebooked flights with no vouchers. Now today I’m flying with a voucher that was a major effort to get from my last flight and our flight has been yet again delayed for 5 hours. Finally on the plane and we are delayed again because they haven’t received the catering delivery. This is a 1.5 hour flight that we have been waiting on for 5 hours. Who cares about the ginger ale at this point. 
Just get us to our destination, I’m done with this airline.
title: No way to rate the airline

review: American Airlines app it’s pretty glitchy. It constantly closes me out, and often if I get out of it and go back to it it takes me to the homepage again instead of the page I was on. My biggest complaint is that there’s no place to obviously see boarding time. When you click on your flight it tells you what time is departs, but not what time at Ford’s. I realize that usually boarding is 30 minutes prior to departure, but this is not always the case. Delta, Alaska, and even frontier airlines tell you what time boarding is in the app, as well as the departure.
title: Take a note from delta

review:
This app makes traveling on American Airlines so much better.  I prefer self service options rather than interacting with gate agents or speaking with customer service on the phone.  

On a recent trip I was able to change my flight using same day flight change in the app. With many options available I was confirmed right away on my new flight.  Changed my seats and navigated to a restaurant I never knew existed at the airport all on the AA app! No human interaction needed!
title: Stellar app!

review: They make it impossible to get  anything beyond just miles. I’ve flown across the Pacific twice and across the country twice and I’m still not going to make it up even one level. What a waste sticking with one airline hoping to get to a level where you can get bumped up to the seats they parade you through while boarding. It’s a sick joke on those who don’t have the money to purchase business and first class.  I spent $1,400 on a flight and got only $400 EQDs. How does that happen?  What a waste of my money!  Like I said, they make it impossible to get ahead. They don’t want their customers getting ahead. And in January, my 1711 EQD’s and 27,000 EQMs will be wiped back to ZERO. What’s the point!?
title: Quitting Advantage Awards Program

review: Tried to book a flight through the app, got all the way through the process (seats picked and everything) to the payment page when I had to switch out of the app to look at a different app. Went back to this app and all of my progress completely disappeared. The worst part is that when I went online to try to book since that failed, the prices had gone up and the seats I had clicked in the app were still showing as selected. American probably won’t fix it because it’s making them money, but leaving them with extremely dissatisfied customers.
title: Doesn’t Save Flight Booking Progress

review:
I downloaded the app because I assumed it would be easier than dealing with the website to purchase the tickets… well I was wrong.
There is no auto complete like you would get just using safari.
They don’t take Apple Pay which I was hoping would save me from entering all of the information but no.
And finally when I made the purchase I got an advertisement to…get this… download the app!
The app did work if only barely and I see reviews saying it helped with checkin so I will update after the flight but for now 2 stars is all I can give
title: Don’t use to purchase the ticket

review: I tried to use this app to change my seat. It charged me $30 to pick a seat, which I understand. But it charged my credit card and then said there was an error and my seat change request was not processed. I tried again. Same thing. Charged my credit card again, but failed to process my seat change request. THEN, once it was time to check in for my flight, more bugs. I completed the process MULTIPLE times, but the app would not give me my boarding pass. Had to call customer service to have them manually check me in. This app is terrible. Flying Delta next time because of this disastrous app.
title: Terrible

review:
I downloaded this to check into my flight and it’s taken over 40 minutes due to the apps numerous problems such as:

-Crashing completely at random times causing it to start over

-Freezing when inputting conf. Number

-not allowing me to select a state for payment options

-not allowing me to remove payment after it wouldn’t let me put in the payment options

-the card scanner didn’t work when I tried that

-the app got stuck at the screen when I tried to start over due to not being able to add a payment option

-I only made it to the payment screen once the other 5+ times it crashed before I got there

It’s actually crazy how many things don’t work or crash the app.  Don’t usually use reviews but after 40 minutes I still haven’t been able to check in when I’ve checked in with similar apps in about 3 minutes.  I would avoid using American Airlines if there is any other option as this is one of the most frustrating apps I’ve ever used.
title: Almost Nothing in the app works

review: I traveled from Boston to Miami and the flight was out of order so they put us on a different flight after 2 hours of delay which was fine for us. While returning from Miami to Boston we had a connecting flight( Philadelphia) so we were told that there is some problem with the flight and after waiting for 4 hours we landed in Philadelphia only to realize that the other flight is also out of order. they made us to wait for 6-7 hours again. We were supposed to reach to Boston at 8pm and we landed at 1.30am. They are horrible. It took us 13 hours to reach from Miami to Boston which is 3.5 hours distance.
title: Horrible and terrible airline.

review: Both of my flights were fully booked this is a pandemic that is totally unexceptionable. My boyfriend and I were getting kicked in our chairs the whole entire family returning flight, the passenger wanted to ask the flight attendant to change my seat because of their actions. They did not stop and made the situation totally my fault. I a very sharp in back and I have to go back to work. I’m very displeased with both of my flights. People were standing up before they were told it was very in organized and not ok. I only flew American because my mom is a flight attendant for American and I don’t think I’m ever gonna fly American again
title: Horrible Flights

review: This app is working well for me and easily allows me to check for updates to my itinerary. However, when I was chatting with a customer service rep (thank you for offering chat), when I tapped on the notification showing me the representative’s message to return to the chat, it took me to the front page of the AA app, and I could not return to the chat. Please fix the ability to tap on a chat notification to return to the chat.
title: Solid app, chat needs work

review: Nearly 4 hour flight to Arizona, pre-downloaded this app waaay ahead of trip to ensure I had it in time for this flight. Brand new Iphone XR, app did not work the ENTIRE flight, despite multiple futile attempts. App would get to where it was going to load a movie, time out, and then kick me out of the system. Worst part is that this flight had no screens on the back of the seats for inflight entertainment as a back-up, so I was screwed on entertainment the entire flight. I much prefer traveling Delta because I have none of these issues and they really take the consumer into consideration. The cherry on the top? All of my family’s bags were diverted. Fly Delta instead if you can.
title: Worst Airline App Ever!!!

review: The app works ok most of the time. However, the lack of good customer from American taints their entire operation. I checked in a bag at 10:22 for a 2:30 flight from Boston to DC Reagan. Yup you guessed it. They DID NOT load my bag. And it’s two and a half hours later. Of course they’ll deliver it “tomorrow” or within 48 hours. That’s a maybe from my perspective since their track record for delivering bags is nil. Just horrendous. One might have anticipated they would have put my bag on an earlier flight since several went out before mine. But nope my bag didn’t get loaded AT ALL.
title: App fine Customer Service - horrible

review: On our first trip our flight got delayed 2 hours to 12 PM. Nothing big. Then it got delayed ANOTHER hour. Keep in mind this was all on the plane. Then they kicked us off and rebooked us for the next day. Then they delayed the next flight for 3 hours then we FINALLY got on after being very late to every reservation and everything we had in place. On our second trip they got on the intercom and said “Oh we are having a slight mechanical issue please stay put as we resolve it” this was after I had woken up at 3 am to get up for my flight and we departed at 4 PM because of American airlines delay fishing everything onboard.
title: Fix your system

review: Well, I’ve been frustrated with this app.  Thinking it would make my life better easier, I began using the mobile boarding app.  No go.  Security station.....red light.  Go to ticket counter...yes, all the way back to a ticket counter I shouldn’t have needed...to get a paper boarding pass..( this happened in 3 airports!)..   then, in airport (2 of them) the gate either did not update a change (1st time) or kept changing from one gate to the next, back again, then changed and it was wrong!  What gives?  So darn frustrating!  Please update and fix this!  Dealing with airports is hard enough ... make the app easy!
title: Just when I needed it...ugh

review: I was very impressed with AA and it’s service flying home from Boston. In our way to Massachusetts we flue with United and during our 5 and a half flight, if we wanted peanuts we had to purchase it. I asked for a ginger ale for my upset stomach and they didn’t have it. American Air not only provided a variety of foods for the flight, but came back towards the end of the flight to offer more snacks. I’ll choose American!
title: Impressive

review: I have been traveling around Europe from the US this Easter 2022. The app is ok but I spent over half hour uploading the COVID related documents according to what was requested by the app. I also added my contact tracing info through the app. However when I got to the airport they said I still had to show them to combis test and vaccine card. So don’t waist your time uploading documents to the app or to the alternative verifly app - it is a total waist of time because they will ask for your vaccine card and negative test anyway at airports, at least for international flights.
title: COVID features are pointless

review: I am writing this review not because the app pestered me to, but because it is one of the most  highly useful and functional on my phone.  EVERY FEATURE ACTUALLY WORKS.  One-stop for my flight and gate info, load my boarding passes right into Apple Wallet and track my luggage.  Same app also enables me to view the flight in progress and check out the entertainment.  User intuitive layout is much appreciated.  GREAT DESIGN.
title: OUTSTANDING

review: Very slow, often get message that it is down (“try again in a few minutes).  This has happened when I am at the very end of the booking process and then I have start all over.  If you have a trip credit (different from a flight credit) you cannot use it without calling the 800 number to speak with an agent.  If changing a flight booked with miles, you have to cancel and start all over with the app or call the 800 number to speak with an agent.  I have 210k miles with AA, (which admittedly is not record breaking) but I truly wish the miles were with another airline.
title: Awkward and slow

review:
??Impossible to download, because of iTunes glitch that Apple is not fixing

Dear developer, it's impossible for us to download your app or buy new ones from iTunes Enterprise MAC that is used both by businesses, schools and individuals who can't afford to download the same app several times for each device.

Please let Apple know about this issue. For the time being till the issue is going to be resolved, we will not be able to update your apps. Thanks for your support!
title: Can't update your app

review:
It is a great app to use while flying.  Loads the data into your apple wallet if you wish.

Updates on flights in real time are great as the updates on where your bags are, when unloaded from the plane etc…  The only  frustrating part now is you know where your bags are…. Just not to obvious why they take so long to get to the carousel.

The app logged me off.  No reason to do that, I also had to Re enter the record locator.  It should remember that stuff.
title: Great app

review: Overall, the app is pretty good.   In some respects it’s actually great.  For example, when a flight gets canceled, the rebooking and reseating process is super smooth and can all be done through the app.  Very nice.  The reason for this comment however, is that for some reason, upcoming trips are identified by airport codes for departure & LAYOVER instead of departure & DESTINATION.  When CLT is the transfer airport for multiple trips to different cities, they all look the same.  Please fix this.
title: Please Fix This

review: Every time you open the app you have to search for your flight. App randomly closes so when you try to view your flight, you often have to reopen the app, search for your flight, etc. I checked in multiple times only to be told I’d have to use the kiosk or desk and get a paper boarding pass. Why bother with the app then?
title: Typical American Airlines Quality

review: Flight back to NY was terrible. The airplane was hot the entire time, the AC was barely on. The children on the plane behind me were yelling and screaming the entire time, with little flight attendance intervention. The children also kept kicking the seat the ENTIRE flight. I believe this could’ve been prevented by some sort of seat change or offering those who were being directing kicked in the back a seat change. I understand children can be unruly, however this type of behavior is unfair to other passengers and some alleviation should’ve been provided.
title: AC and Children on the Plane

review: My complaint is about the airline and the app. One and the same. You don’t get one without the other. Companies try to hide behind this and say this is for technical reviews about their app — hogwash. Own up. American Airlines is crap when it comes to customer service and a poor excuse globally when it comes to airlines. Literally third-world customer treatment and service. It is a disgrace and, I am embarrassed that “American” is in its brand. It is well beyond time for American Airlines to own up to its shoddy customer experiences, miserable operations, and overall crap excuse for an airline. It’s a shame. There’s a reason why American is also joked about as “Ghetto Air”.
title: Ghetto Air

review:
1.  Cannot understand why there are no direct flights between LAX and Mexico City 
2. Time between flights at DFW is unrealistic. On both outbound and return, we were unable to purchase food. We had to survive on your tiny snack packs because, despite full flights, you are not offering food for purchase. We barely had our connection in DFW on the return. 
3. DFW to Mexico City plane was old and reflected it age. 
4. Three of our four bags were delayed and had to be delivered the next day. 
5.  Baggage turn from plane to passengers, in LAX, is painfully slow. I assume you no longer care about your passengers once the flight has landed.
title: Mexico City to LAX

review: My thanks to each and every Team AA Member! The trip I was on was absolutely great! Each leg of this journey was made special by each Team Member I had the privilege to meet. Each person was so very helpful, courteous, and kind and I am grateful to have enjoyed another wonderful experience, I am already looking forward to my next adventure! Thank you for all you do and all the best!!!
title: Another Fantastic 10 Leg Trip!!!

review:
American is doing their best to become a third rate budget airline. 
Witness the shambles that IT is and has been, with absolutely no compunction about ignoring input from users. And users are customers who pay their salaries. 
American is also ignoring their most important stakeholders (paying customers) in the disastrous retrofit of the 737 fleet. It is particularly ironic that the model for the retrofit is the grounded 737 MAX. The flight worthiness of the MAX matches the unusable interiors. First class is now economy, economy is inhumane. 
American needs to find a reason for customers to continue to fly with them: everything they have done to date certainly discourages me from flying this third rate budget airline.
title: ExecPlat family

review: This app is all fluffy graphics and no bones. “Sorry.  Something went wrong.” appears in half of your flight queries, especially if you’re trying to book with miles. Oh, and it won’t notify you of canceled flights if you set it up to notify you. “Sorry.” You just went through security and wasted a morning... if the app worked to notify you when the flight was canceled as you were parking. The experiences with the app haven’t improved in a year. It makes me want to cancel our credit card with them. It makes me want to throw my phone. It makes me wonder if my 1990s Packard Bell would compute better than their terrible mobile servers.
title: Dust off the Packard Bell

review:
When creating a button, you need to list in the requirements that the button must be visible in the screen so that users can select it! It is so ridiculous that the “Continue” button is covered by a stupid swipe up menu. I wish app designers would not be so “creative”. This is a utility app, not one used for pleasure. Sometimes you just need to give people a smooth experience, not try to “innovate”.

I can only surmise that AA wants to make it as difficult as possible for me to change my trip. I will be deleting the app shortly after my flight, and probably never flying American again.
title: Buttons inaccessible

review:
I can’t even check in for my flight because the check in flow buttons are completely unresponsive. There are many bugs with this AA app version including trying to select an expiration date for my passport, the date resets and then it takes an additional 3 tries to get it to stick. “Skip seats” button is unresponsive in seat selection flow. Make sure to test on latest iOS 15, you are missing major bugs and this is the most popular iOS user version as of currently. Overall bad user experience. 

-An actual paid QA specialist for iOS apps
title: Please do a better job quality checking your app

review:
The service at this airline is terrible. No one cares about their job especially when dealing with operational issues that could potentially be resolved by employees.  
Case on point.  The jetway at SFO experienced a mechanical issue.  We sat on the airplane for 40 minutes before someone decided to move to the next gate which was wide open the entire 40 minutes.   
On our journey out to MIA, upon arrival, we sat at our gate for 20 minutes because no ramp employees were available to signal the aircraft safely.  
It makes no sense.  I blame this purely on culture.  The top brass needs to do a better job earning their 6 and 7 digit salaries.
title: Poor service

review: In the last month or so my app will only show current flight info if I am traveling.  The other menu items either never appear, show for 3 seconds and disappear, or very rarely are available. I have spent entire flights unable to get to my wifi subscription because all I can see is my current flight and there is nothing else to click on.  Oh, there is a “loading” circle at the top of the page that never actually loads anything.  For $50 a month I would like my wifi.  And many times I am trying to book flights but don’t have a way to access the option from my app.
title: No access to menu items

review: This app works about as good as this airline. I am currently flying back home and the app still shows my luggage missing from the previous flight. For an added bonus, I keep getting alerts of seat changes on average of 5 every minute which is awesome considering it is the exact same seat every alert. The automatic “bump” the app or airline does to you when it/they know you’re going to miss your next flight due to the 2 or 3 delays you will get once in the airport is handy. I have seen some parts of this globe that I never thought I would due to the taxi shuttle planes I have been bumped to.
title: American Indeed

review: This app is by far the least user friendly of any of its peers. The interfaces are terrible and very little works as it should. For example, I have added my TSA precheck number multiple times and it still never shows up on my ticket. Also, I just spent an hour trying to get miles from a work flight because it doesn't automatically sync my aadvantage number automatically. Even the least noble of their competition does these things automatically. American is clearly in last place on this front
title: Worst app in the industry

review: The app is very useful on my phone (I exclusively fly AA, so I use it often), but I was so disappointed to find that it’s not available on Kindle. I specifically bought a Kindle Fire because I read an article (and have noticed) that AA is pulling out seat back TVs on their fleet, and there’s no way I can watch movies on a phone during long flights. Please figure this out for those of us who want the ability to read AND enjoy the in-flight entertainment on a Kindle, especially if the whole reason you’re pulling TVs from planes because “everyone has a tablet these days.”
title: Should be available on Kindle

review:
Knock on wood, but I honestly don’t understand why the rating of this app is six feet under. The app is great, and serves its purpose with perfection. Of course I kept checking with the screens at the airport making certain the times were right, and it was! Though, I do believe the app didn’t give the gate number until I had found it out when I got there. Yeah yeah it’s on the ticket but we all know the numbers are NOT a promise. Ha. 

The app is awesome.
title: Why 2.4?

review: The app is pretty good for day-of travel, even planning and purchasing travel, but the terminal maps are not much better than a Sharpie on a cocktail napkin. The map for CLT does not label terminals (DFW map has them) yet they include layers for food and services. This information is useless. If I’m planning my connections and I am unfamiliar with an airport, I should be able to see how far terminal E is from terminal C. Once I’m on that journey, finding food is just a matter of looking. The terminal maps need a major upgrade American.
title: Terminal Maps

review:
The most horrible airline in the country . By far. And just when you think I they couldn’t do any worse they seem to go even lower even their standard of work culture .

Flight gets delayed from Columbia SC and results in missed connections . They sold out all flights even the next day . Didn’t want to bother returning phone calls. And when I finally got to Greenville NC it took them 1 hour to bring the bags to the baggage claim . Had only one agent loading the plane and doing curbside pickup and they waited for flight to depart before bringing bags . What atrocious work culture and customer care !
title: Horrible service all around

review: I flew them in April and now June and both times we had over a 3 hour delay at the Dallas International.  In April we actually sat on the plane on the runway until they fixed something on the plane for 3 hours. This time it ended up to be over a 6 hour delay and we had to change terminals 5 times. They didn’t help the old people relocate to another gate a mile away from each other. This is unacceptable and very unprofessional.  This is the worse airline I have ever flown with. I’m going to stick with South West. By far they are a five star rating NOT AMERICAN. This is so sad and they should compensate us travelers. 👎👎👎👎👎👎
title: This is the worse airline.

review: Left MN to DFW today on schedule. Arrived at 10:30am to DFW to leave out at scheduled 2:30 flight. Inquired at 10:30 @ gate B15 to see if we could fly out on earlier scheduled flight to AEX at 12:30 instead of waiting until 2:30. Gate person was not helpful, didn’t even check availability; waved us off. We returned to Gate 35  and waited until 2:30 flight out. Arrived home to AEX to discover our bags had been placed with the earlier flight!! To top it off at our small home airport the counter crew is also the gate check person so it took an HOUR to retrieve the bags that had made it to the airport 2 hours before we landed!! Aarrgh!!
title: Aggravated

review: I’ve flown American Airlines and my connecting flights are always canceled. When this happens, it’s always when I’m half way to my destination and the app tells me it’s cancelled much later. So if you want after the fact notifications, download it. AA help desk is so rude. One attendant was too busy flirting with his boss and eyeing her up and down, to help me confirm a cancellation. They were standing in a corner near the help desks. He literally looked at me, rolled his eyes, and slowly walked up to his desk to help me. His boss was equally annoyed I asked politely for help and broke her away from her relationship endeavor with her staff member. Awful app and two awful employees.
title: Flights are cancelled and late notifications

review: I HATE this app. It doesn’t sync my travel plans, it doesn’t record my miles (which is why I downloaded it to begin with), doesn’t seem to find my flight info when I search for it AND I always have to attempt to log in at least 3 times. THAT is frustrating, sometimes it accepts my email and other times it will only log in with my advantage member ID. You’re probably thinking this is operator error and the person writing this review just doesn’t know what they’re doing. I promise I’m not an imbecile, there are so many frustrating things about this app and it’s not worth it. I wish I could give it negative stars.
title: HATE everything about it

review: My grandson just returned from South Carolina on flight 6085 which was very turbulent. He’s 10 years old it’s probably his third flight but he got motion sickness from all the turbulence and the pilot came out after the flight was over and gave him a pin the wings made his night made his day thank you for your consideration and I’d love to know the pilots name so I can send him a personal thank you
title: flight 6085

review: Traveled with a family member that has a feeding tube.  Called American Airlines weeks before flight to explain and find out the procedures that needed to be taken.
