Day of travel instead of any assistance I was told that the liquid in which feeds my family member, liquid that is her whole means of survival, instead I was told the medically needy suitcase would have to be checked.  As I stated the liquid was her only means of survival!! While trying to explain this, I got a slap on the counter telling me, “just go deal with TSA!!!  Which that is a whole other review!!
title: Rudeness and lack of communication

review:
1-) Contact list capacity is nearly none (I only can save 4 passengers) for this reason avoiding to buy American as much as possible, if I have to use American flight using Orbitz app instead. Waiting someone at aa to notice the problem literally for years now. 

2-) Uses email/telephone number combination to identify unique record, disregards mixing passenger name into finding duplicate reservations. Really frustrating. This is a new problem, just noticed today

3-) Too many questions  with randomly spaced check boxes in check out. If all the questions were necessary, one wishes check boxes was clearly at same position in following lines 

4-) For years now, app asks last name at login , once you type it automatically overrides account number to last name field, you than need yo retype last name again to login. Hard to believe developer is not aware of this for so many years 

Other than these average intuitive  app.
title: Anonymous

review: Great all around service from the minute I walked into the airport! My flight updates were on my AA app. The AA agent( Jasmine ) gave continual updates and was efficient & pleasant, always patient! Flight was uneventful ( a good thing!) and all staff was friendly! I’d like to give a shout out to the flight  &  ground crew handling the baggage for in flight checking in. Everyone works so efficiently! A pleasurable experience!
title: Great Overall Service!

review:
Although I’m always wishing there was a better advantage to being Gold (I HAVE enjoyed Platinum a number of years), I appreciate the friendly hospitable service that I am usually awarded as a passenger. I’m aware of the difficult task that your employees are charged with on a daily basis - and yet, they (most of them) USUALLY come through with a smile on their face. 

Thank you!
title: Typically great / friendly service

review:
Trying to upgrade is difficult to find. Sometimes it pops up, other times not. 

I’m still not able to figure out how to check in and not pay for my baggage as a Audrey Advantage card holder. It is stated in my benefits that I do not need to pay for baggage, yet even when I pay for the ticket and use the credit card number for check in, I am required to pay.
title: Sometimes difficult to navigate

review: I’ve often flown on AA and have always. Loved their service, especially that it seems you’ve “doubled up” on attention to details during these   tough times. I especially wholeheartedly support the airlines enforcing the necessary rules and regulations pertaining to COVID-19 and feel disheartened at how some passengers respond. But better times are ahead,Just beyond the horizon. Smile and keep flying high!!
title: Superb al always…

review: For frequent fliers we need the dates to stay on the app consistently when you’re going through and booking the flight to make sure you selected the correct dates. Also, sometimes the app freezes after you select the seats, you close it out and reopen it but the seat you selected isn’t available because you JUST selected it. There needs to be an option to retrieve a reservation that was just being completed.
title: Include dates everywhere

review: Worst airline ever, American Airlines is nothing but spirit. We left rdu on time landed in aus  and there was not gate available. My question is if you know a plane is set to arrive at a certain time why would you put another plane there for maintenance? We were waiting on a gate for an hour, missed my connection flight and they put me on a flight that’s 4 hours later. Don’t get me started on how i was on a 4hrs wait for a call back, finally got it saying hello like crazy just for a representative not to answer and hangs up on me. There’s no accommodation no nothing, i honestly just my money back smh. DO BETTER
title: Worst airline ever

review: No issue with the flight it was however 100% full so when you fly a full plane it seems redundant to make people exit 2 rows at the time when you spend 2 hours close contact. And I had just bought my bag this morning because my zipper ripped so I thought a new one would be safer but my bad came out looking like a car had run over it . Not very happy about that
title: All is well but the bag took a beating

review: I am extremely disappointed by the events of today concerning my flights delayed departure from MSY.  My initial flight was delayed due to a mechanical concern however the issue was remedied but the crew decided they were not comfortable taking that aircraft. This caused a ripple effect and has impacted my flight and connecting times.  Staff working the gates in both MSY and CLT were extremely friendly and helpful. Upon arrival to RDU it has been determined that my bag has not arrived and will not be here until tomorrow around noon.  This is completely unacceptable and a great inconvenience considering there was ample time for my bag to connect.
title: Displeased with travel

review: Loaded app for my flight. Kept me up to date with timely notifications. Alerted me my return flight was cancelled before the gate attendant even knew. Rebooked me on next available with boarding passes before I even got to the booking counter to rebook a new flight.  Avoided the very long line of disgruntled passengers who did not apparently have the app.  Highly recommend this app.
title: Loved it

review:
Why is “request a wheelchair” in the most prominent spot on the screen? I know I’ve accidentally hit it several times since it’s been added. 
  
Im Executive Platinum. If I saw the app for the first time I’d assume this was a credit card app that might have a travel component. It’s everywhere and adds more clutter to a laughably cluttered interface. 
  
I like that I can bid to give away my seat now for a voucher. Seems half baked though that I can’t be notified via the app to see a gate agent if they end up needing me. Yesterday was the first time I’d been given the alternate flight options when I bid. That was nice. 
  
Late notifications.  I was notified a day after my upgrade that I got upgraded. I had already noticed and changed my upgraded seat. Then right before check I got a very confusing “you’ve been upgraded!” Notification. Come on guys.
title: Is there a UI designer in the house?

review: I installed this app to use the chat to request special meals on an upcoming flight. Aside from a two-hour (!) wait on hold (all the while seeing a message that I was third in line for the entire two hours), with the app installed, my phone acted oddly. It would make noises while being recharged, and start to light up even after I had shut it down completely. Googling the problem, I learned that it could be caused by an unstable app. So I removed this app. I am an American Airlines Frequent Flyer, but I don’t want the kinds of phone problems that arose after this app was installed. I can live without it.
title: Unstable App

review: Used to work fine, but update (running 5.16) on iPad is now horrible. Most fonts are now so large, the blind old lady across the room can read what is on my app. Because of the excessively large font, most info displays with just “...” (gate is now “g...,” time is now “t...,” etc.). Flight info tiles do not center, so swiping between flights in a reservation will display 1/3 of the first flight and 2/3 of the second.
title: What happened?

review:
I have installed the widget on my home screen, and it displays the number of upcoming trips and the next upcoming trip. Currently, I should have 6 upcoming trips. 

Every time I access the widget, and click on a trip, then when I go back to the Home Screen, the number of trips on the widget drops by one. I have repeated this with each upcoming trip, and have watched my displayed number of upcoming trips drop one by one.
title: Missing Trips

review:
App requires iOS 13 and phone will only update to 12.5.5. Oh well......

Update / Clarification: I selected the app from the App Store. It told me my os was not current enough for the current version of the app and would I ike to download that last compatible version. So far so good. Downloaded last compatible version. Started up and I logged in. 

After logging in, I got a dialog box “Version Update Required / In order to use our travel app, please update to the newest version.”

Choices are Cancel or Update. 

Update - again, asks me to download an older version of the app.

If I cancel and select app from phone, I get the Version Update Required” message again.
title: IPhone 6 Plus cannot run app

review: I got a notice that my itinerary had been changed. But instead of updating the data in the app, the notice just said to check back later to see what changed.  Terrible service. We have an absolutely must-catch connection. We are traveling the day before the connecting flight and staying overnight at the connection city to make sure we make that connection the next day. But the first flight we are taking has been changed.  Terrifying.  American Airlines is so irresponsible. The least the app could do is download and display the update.
title: Slow flight updates

review: What a nice app experience. Searched airfares for my trip. Booked it. Paid for trip. Paid for bag fee online. Upgraded to first class online. App kept me informed of flight times, gate location, bag arrival, terminal and gate locations  American app is nice and easy to use. It’s informative and probably convinced me to fly this airline again because of the ease of booking travel using the app. Good job all!
title: App review

review: If you fly first class I strongly recommend you avoid american. Rude and ignorant staff (you have no idea how many times I got an “I don’t know” reply for simple questions). useless advantage program (over 150k miles never used and switching from a first class ticket because of availability and still couldn’t get on the upgrade list and no one knows why). A staff member literally told me she doesn’t care if I complain (great customer service). Never flying AA again and taking my business to airlines that truly provide a better experience to first class passengers.
title: If you fly first class Avoid american

review: The airline itself was a good experience. Easy to obtain boarding passes through the application. My complaint about inconsistency is there were several carry-ons that were of larger size, yet ours were checked for sizing and made to be checked in. We weren’t too happy about this. I understand this can happen but be consistent amongst ALL passengers and carry-ons. Can’t show some leniency for some and not others. This can upset the wrong person and cause bigger issues.
title: Inconsistency

review: This morning I checked in for a flight using my app no problem. Then I installed the most recent app update. Now I am trying to check in for my return flight and the “check in” button starts with “loading” and then stops, no results and no boarding pass. Please fix the bug. Iphone iOS 14.2.
title: Problem w new app update

review: Of any airline I’ve flown, this app is by far the most elegant. It’s simple, aesthetically pleasing and useful. Push notifications are frequent and informative - many airlines I’ve flown don’t even use them or they arrive about 20 min too late. Making reservations or changes is easy. And it updates iOS wallet with changes too. Great stuff
title: Hands down the best airline app

review: It alerts you when your plan is about too take off, it tells you when too check in and so much more. Your boarding pass is right there and you can put it in your Apple wallet or keep it in the app. Downloading this was the best decision I made and made flying 10x less stressful being able too see everything right there. I’m glad I use American Airlines.
title: Fast and Perfect

review: I just wrote a lengthy chat message about an in-flight issue in the AA app chat. I hit send and it responded that wait times were long. It asked if I would like to wait, yes or no. I said no, thinking it’d convert the chat to an email or someone would write me back later; it instead just ended the session and said write again if I have future questions. Huh? It should at least point me to a different source for help. At best, it should log my chat and have someone contact me when someone is available. That current set up is like an automated inattentive phone agent.
title: App chat just dropped my issue

review:
I travel all the time and I love how functional and accessible this app is! Love the notifications I get about my flight. The design is so well thought out. If you have issues with this app then there must be something wrong with you and your aren’t going anywhere in life. It’s not app it’s you. 
But in all seriousness this app has made my travel experience so much easier and stress free!
title: Well designed app

review:
This app was great until someone thought it would be good not to show your up to date frequent flyer status. I was flying mainly with American and had just a few flights to go until I had my gold status. Now, the chart that shows you your status is blank. How much more do I need to do to get my gold status? Who knows!
I wrote a complaint and got the run around. It seems to me that the app was modified to allow less people to have frequent flyer status. Why else would you change it! If it isn’t broke don’t fix it. My one star rating stands until they make the frequent flyer status more visible.
title: Disappointed

review: I had a connecting flight in PHX on my way home to Austin. The gate agents who helped me track down my valet tagged bag to ensure it was rushed + transferred to my final destination were all helpful. One gate agent in particular went above and beyond in providing excellent customer service — her communication and follow-through were much appreciated. Thank you AA crew and staff!  I now have my bag in hand at home💜
title: Excellent gate agent assistance

review: I had a $750 paper voucher. I called American Airlines. They told me I must send that voucher into corporate office. Once it arrived, they converted it to an evoucher. They said told me if I wanted to use that voucher to pay for check-I’m luggage, I had to wait to do that at the airport. When I arrived to the airport on my day of departure, customer service said that evouchers are not an acceptable form of payment but paper vouchers are acceptable, and that there’s a disconnect between their system and corporates. So I had to pay for my checked luggage... When I called AA, to ask protocol, and I was informed to do everything that would prevent me from using my voucher. That is unacceptable and costly to me.
title: Vouchers

review: First of let me start by saying I’m a software developer and I’m impressed by the UX design by this Airline but the functionality of this app is just pathetic. The app opens and loads and then freezes upon an attempt to maneuver through tabs. I can’t even search my flight without the app freezing. You can reduce all the fancy images and everything you guys have to improve performance. People are just trying to book and track flights! This app is causing a severe inconvenience to me and other people around the world. Please consider an update sooner than later.
title: PLEASE UPDATE

review:
You n the past, I’ve hesitated to fly American but I have to admit over the past year of flying with them, their customer service is outstanding (especially at Sea-Tac main desk). Their flights are usually full, but comfortable. They arrive on time and sometimes early. Their app is very informative & easy to use too. 
Definitely recommend!
title: Surprised by American

review: I feel like this app wasn’t always so user friendly.  Has everything.  Easy look at mileage/status.  Info on in flight amenities.  When possible seat info.  Accessible upgrade info.  I just wish that the upgrade info/flight rewards updated a little faster.  Besides that, no notes!
title: Pretty much perfect app

review: Really rude person boarding in PHL on the way to Charlotte. I am not complaining on the fact that she made me check-in my hand luggage…. I am complaining on the how. There was lot of aggressively and the process of checking being totally inconsistent (other people did not have to check in with bigger hand luggages. I am annoyed by the aggressive attitude and clearly felt discriminated. Looks like the person forget we were customers (she even shouted….. ling story short she did not being the best of me). Terrible experience that totally removed the rest of the experience that was great
title: Boarding process in PHL

review:
I recently took 6 trips with American Airlines. Was not able to get the in flight entertainment to work on a single flight. Would connect to the wifi in my settings, return to the app and click wifi and free entertainment. It would bring me back to the screen saying I needed to be connected to wifi. Checked again, and I was connected to wifi. Could load airport maps and check the status of my layover no problem. App is updated with latest version. 
App is basically garbage just like this airline.
title: In Flight Entertainment does nothing.

review: I haven’t experienced too many problems with the app.  With the most recent version though, when you go to check in, it now asks you about how many bags your bringing and asks for you to pay for them at that time.  I don’t see the exemption options you see when using check in kiosks at the airport.  Can something like this please be included?
title: That update tho

review: I would expect from the app not to ask for password after user is authenticated with thumbprint on mobile device. I was trying to book a flight and at the end when I’m ready to purchase the ticket, the system ask for password, and while I’m entering all the information, it tells me that times run out to buy a ticket. Try to do it three times and it seems like catch22. Plus the app does not remember last searches and flight picks. This is the most ridicules and user offensive approach. One star, till you fix it!
title: Unhappy with login and booking experience.

review: I travel often on American because it’s the only airline that flies out of our hometown. Yes, I’ve experienced delays and cancellations just like everyone else and I’ve felt frustrated and disappointed. Generally though,  I’ve been very happy with the airline and the services of the personnel employed by the airline.  Overall, I’d rate American a five star experience and I’m grateful for the opportunity to fly with them!
title: Great Airline!

review:
How American Airlines has 4.5 rating is beyond me. They must of gave out discounts for good ratings.

Where do I begin.. the 10 hour flight from Chicago to Hawaii didn’t have WiFi and ran out of water on the flight. When I asked for more water they said I should of grabbed a bottle at the last airport. NOTE none of the flights have working WiFi. Make sure you download things to watch or bring a book. 

Flight from Hawaii to LA we boarded sat on the plane for 2 hours before they got on the speaker and told us the pilot might of been exposed to covid and that we would have to deviate the plane and make a new flight. Which we waiting 3 hours to speak to someone at the service desk and all they did was give us a $25 voucher and was told we could use it anywhere in the airport. Which was not true. No one would expect it.

What a disgrace for an airline. I would advice you never book American airline.
title: WORST EXPERIENCE EVER!

review: Even with the “auto-update” feature turned on, the app does not update gate changes reliably once you get your mobile boarding pass from the app and store it on your wallet. Yes you are supposed to check the screens at the airport, but what’s the point of having an auto-update feature if it doesn’t work? This can cause you to miss your flight or park in the wrong terminal, which I have done multiple times now. The rest of the app is pretty flawless except for this one glaring, rather important issue!
title: Don’t trust automatic boarding pass update

review:
My original flight had been canceled then the flight that I had ended up rescheduling for got delayed twice and then also canceled due to your company being short staffed meaning not only did I miss work, but I missed the sleep required to preform my work duties causing me to be unable to work the next day. 

After finally finding a flight for the THIRD reschedule this flight was delayed again, not once but twice. Again.. due to no crew being available. 

After boarding the plane is was almost an hour before we were even able to attempt to take off due to your company being short staffed again.  And unable to push the plane back. 

I lost a total of over 24 hours of work time due to this airlines inability to effectively hire and maintain their staff. 

Stop selling tickets if you don’t have seats. You’re costing customers time which is in fact money.
title: HIRE MORE STAFF.

review:
It is very uncustomary friendly for Americans airlines to make their App  require latest iphone software when it worked fine. It says uses last version if you do not have latest phone- but no option to do thst

The app is not backward compatible and is usless on an iphone on it wgich it worked before.
  Pure quality  and poor customer service since your app is not  backward compatible - to Assume customers will buy the latest phone to use an AA app is lack of foresight failure at VP  of tech level in American Airlines

American airline designed and  App not for american airline customers but help apple sell latesr Apple phone, its mind boggling - please pass feedback to rhe CEO  and senior vp of American airlines  customer  service and IT.

American airline app for me as a customer is a piece of junk software- i used app for 3 urs and now it does not work and want me to buy a new apple phone! Who thought of that bright idea??
title: AA useless app

review:
I use this app a lot, given my loyalty (!) to AA. It is functionally well-designed and gets you all the necessary information fast and intuitively. I also like that it updates you on the real-time status of your bags pretty accurately. 

It never crashed on me, and updates itself seamlessly and without issues. Like I said, it does what it needs to do and well.
title: A well-designed and useful airline app

review: This is the worst experience I’ve ever had with any sort of customer satisfaction. Was scheduled to fly out to California for some awesome engagement photos but instead, we waited at the airport for 6 hours. Finally we got an update that stated our flight was now scheduled to depart 4 and a half hours after our original departure time. This made it impossible for us to make Our connecting flight in Phoenix. I will never buy a plane ticket from American Airlines. Totally disappointed and we were given limited options that did absolutely nothing to help our situation.
title: DO NOT FLY AMERICAN AIRLINES

review: Who cares what the app is like. The airline is trash. Late leaving out of Savannah because “the plane needed to be gassed up”. Wait what??! You didn’t think of that before we got on the plane?? Then we taxi forEVER because I’m sure we needed to be fit in line departing because we were late to begin with. Then we land in Dallas and taxi forEVER again and have to wait at the gate because of “gate congestion”. Which is awesome with a 6 month old. Missing flights and potentially missing b work isn’t stressful at all. Will seriously reconsider ever buying any ticket with this airline again.
title: This airline is trash

review: App is not user friendly. I just want my boarding pass on my phone, but I have to jump through all kinds of hoops to get it. Also the app asks for too much personal info. People don’t trust technology, never assume that they do. I had to give them a way to much contact info and I still couldn’t get my boarding pass. The level of info they require is unnecessary. Other airlines do not require this stuff. They just want contact info to spam you. Garbage app. We just want our boarding passes, no one cares about other useless features. Garbage garbage
title: Hard to navigate and asks for too much personal info

review: This app is unequivocally one of the worst I’ve ever experienced. My advice is strictly for AA to book a flight on United and compare it to a flight on American. There aren’t enough characters to express the embarrassment I would have to say I was an AA web app developer. Not going to waste any more time on AA than the ordeal it is to deal with this garbage app.
title: Leagues behind other Airline Apps

review: I fly a lot and have never gotten to the point where I felt the need to write a review for an airline. Their app updates flight changes without notifying customer. My partner and I have been at the airport for 24 hours now as they continue changing our flights. 21 hour wait for phone customer service line. No refund or compensation offered. We are now 2 days late for our 4 day long vacation trip. Lost $800 on our Airbnb due to the delay and they continue to refuse any compensation. I will never fly American again.
title: 2 and half days and six flight changes later.

review: The website and app purposefully hide key cancellation details from you when you’re booking your flight, and then if you cancel your flight it sends with with *allllll* the relevant cancellation details that you didn’t know before, and maybe would’ve chose a different option if you knew. Hiding info is schemey and wrong, AA should be better than this (and be better on a lot of different things but that’s a long conversation). Be better AA! Don’t be such a capitalist money hungry horror of a company and don’t hide info from your users ✌️
title: Hides Information from the user

review:
Hey guys! I am no longer seeing my boarding pass on my locked screen. I am still getting alerts like boarding has begun and ticket / gate changes. The boarding pass however is not persistent on the lock screen. I’ve read several forms and help sites across the web and have followed all the recommendations. Wondering if it’s just me. 

Like the app. Would love it if my tickets would persist on the Lock Screen.
title: Boarding Pass on Lock Screen - NOT Working

review: Your latest update is slow to load and crashes the iOS constantly. I can’t even book a flight now. Whatever you did, you didn’t do very good regression testing because basic things like logging into the app, loading airport codes, buying extra miles, seat upgrades, are causing the app to crash. We expect better from you! Put some money into your app Testing or at the very least build in automation. It’s a standard for mobile app dev these days.
title: Regression Test Your Updates!

review: App doesn’t remember info, constantly locks you out, and doesn’t offer Face ID compatibility . Come on people you are a world class airliner with a low class app. If you ever get locked out of the account you have to call customer service which takes an hour to four hours on hold or waiting for a call back. Benefits are on the fly seat changes and ticket changes if you bought the insurance. I’m giving it 2 stars because American Airlines has really dropped the ball on this app.
title: Issues

review: Attempted to book flight five times, app would glitch and lose flight info.  When I’d go back the seats I was trying to book were still held in the incomplete reservation I was previously trying to make.  Had to wait for it to time out to attempt to rebook same seats only to have it crash again.  Most frustrating experience ever trying to book flights with this app.  To top it off, the rates increased significantly in the two hours I’ve been trying to complete a simple reservation.
title: Keeps losing reservation before completing booking.

review: Was a decent app until without warning they cut off any use unless you had IOS13, which millions of phones won’t support. Their web/app support didn’t care - saying I should get a new phone. I wrote a complaint in but heard nothing. Now it says there’s an update that is still compatible with IOS 12+, but it won’t download. A huge FAIL on AA’s part, and for support they tell you it’s only possibly to chat from the app...which doesn’t work.
title: Requires IOS 13

review: Great App. Been using for years and never have trouble with it. All the user that say it want load  is weird unless they all are using 5 yr old phones. They have improved it more and more.  I wish they would add a better flight status tool. That is my only complaint at this time. I love not having adds like United and others!
title: Great App . Keep adding features!

review: I had a horrible experience this morning at the Mitchell airport in Milwaukee WI with an employee named Lewis P and her counterpart that was working next to her this morning at 4:45am. (I couldn’t see her name tag) They were condescending and rude and actually rolled their eyes and laughed at me when I didn’t know my connecting flight off of memory, as I only knew my final destination was Reno, Nevada. While I was pulling up my ticket they were actually snuck tying together saying “who doesn’t know their flight info...”. Absolutely appalled at this behavior and I will reconsider booking American again because of being treated like this
title: Check in employees horrible attitude

review: The day before my flight leaves I download the app and I use it to see when I board and then I keep it handy for the duration of my vacation wherever that may be. Once I am back at home I uninstall the app. It’s pretty easy to use I am happy that it shows me where my luggage is and I know how soon I need to be at the airport to board. I don’t ask for much more than that.
title: It does what I needed to do.

review:
I heard on the news that American Airlines was going to begin filling up their flights by having passengers in the middle seat. I was concerned about my safety. Surprised that didn’t happen on my trip. Everyone wore mask and were participating in social distancing. The plane had plenty of space for all passengers. 

Great and safe flight.
title: Better experience than I thought

review:
So I’m sitting on my laptop at a work desk near my departure gate as I like to do before a flight (with the AA app in the foreground on my phone). I see we’re about 20 minutes from boarding and wrap things up. I walk over to my gate C39 at DFW but the usual crowd is nowhere to be found. 

I have to manually refresh the app to learn the gate has been changed to C4 - the total opposite side of the terminal (and a tram ride away). Now only 14 minutes to get there. In the 21st century of connected everything, this is a huge customer expectation fail in my book.
title: Lame - No Notice of Gate Change

review: I typically fly Delta and the American experience is not at the same level.  The app is way less easy to use.  The Delta app typically checks you in as your opening it.  It’s easy to see all the necessary information at all once.  Also, the two of the three flights on American had no screens.  I’m never on a Delta flight without screens.  The people in Detroit were very friendly.  That was the best part of the experience.
title: App and planes

review: Horrible service! No one knows anything and there’s no managers or supervisor that have any power to do anything. Me and my fiancé was on time to the gate, the guy and girl are so busy talking to each other they didn’t acknowledge us being there and then 10min later gonna say we’re sorry the plane has left. What!! Then I can’t get a refund I’m being forced to fly with them even though I had a horrible experience. It’s a corporate structure that’s built to take your money and never give it back even if it’s there fault. I rather fly spirit after this!
title: Worst experience ever!

review: I book a certain seat on my weekly flights back home from work. Never once had a problem until my flight last night. Gate agent in LA basically told me it wasn’t my business my seat that I booked way in advance was changed to another seat.. I book this particular seat all the time because of room and COVID SPACE since AA packs the planes. Gate agent in LA said to me if I didn’t like the seat he gave tuff luck you don’t have to fly with us!!!.?.!.!.?.?.! At the end of the flight I looked back at my original seat was empty... THIS WOULD MAKE THE DALI LAMA MAD..
title: Switched my regular seat without zero notice

review:
I love American.  I’m disappointed with the following:

1). I fly a ton, yet I have NO flexibility with changing my flight.  My route most commonly used doesn’t seem to have an issue filling seats either. This is DCA to MIA.

2). In currently taking my second international trip NOT on American. These are to Dubai and Rabat, Morocco.  I know you have an option with codeshare in most cases, but the times are terrible compared to other airlines.
title: Mr Hodge

review:
Your lack of true first class service is becoming an issue for those of us who purchase first class fares.
Covid is no longer an excuse for no glassware and proper meals….
If you cannot get back to normal, I will be forced to change carriers.
The Flight Attendants are the only thing keeping you together as they have been awesome!!
title: In flight service

review:
I book flights directly with all airlines through their Apps every week several times. Every other airlines lists upcoming flights which I book...American does not list all bookings and forces me to screen shot all bookings so I do not book flights twice which I have done before because the App does not show the flight in upcoming trips. 
This is a HUGE headache. I don’t know why when I have my flyer number attached to every booking and booking directly through the American App the flights aren’t all listed. 
Your killing me AA!
title: Need to list all bookings

review: I tried upgrading my flight by purchasing economy premium. The price on the app and website were the same but when I try to purchase I get an error. Two AA HelpDesk calls and no one can help. They did not even try to fix the website or app. The price has been the same for the upgrade for a month. Now they want to charge me double than what shows on there website. So disappointed in the customer service.
title: Shows a lower rate and then won’t let you upgrade

review: Just got off a flight from HNL to ORD flight 74. The crew above the flight was fantastic! Very attentive to anything the customer might need. I was tended to by an attendant named Linda. I just can’t say enough great things about her. Personal service and level of care was exactly as I would hope my own employees would conduct their jobs. Really wowed this passenger!
title: Excellent service

review:
I have an iPhone 6, with iOS 12.5.4 - the last update Apple provided to run on that model. Your AA App is displaying pop up windows that say “Version Update Required. In order to use our travel app please update to the latest version. The latest version of your software appears to require iOS 13.”

The iPhone 6 model will not run iOS 13, so I can no longer use the AA app. Please fix, by allowing previous iOS to still run. Even if it doesn’t include newer features. 

Your app has become essential for work.
title: Last update requires a phone that can run iOS 13

review: I’m an Executive Platinum member with American and the app is horrible. It rarely refreshes and half the time I get an error message. I haven’t been able to log in all week and I fly twice a week. I have to print my boarding pass off my computer. It’s really inconvenient! I called tech help and the wait is 1 hour 45 mins to 2 hours 20 mins. Are you serious!! It says to press 1 for a call back and that doesn’t even work. Horrible.
title: Horrible App

review: This app is good to get your boarding pass. Booking travel, adding a pet, getting baggage status are awful features. Seldom up to date and the info is not the same as the desktop version. By far the worst feature is the chat option. No longer can we get contact options, we only have the chat option which is a frustrating as tires stuck in mud. Avoid the headache and use a laptop or other computer to get the info you need.
title: One good feature. That’s it.

review: Took 5 minutes to fill out all fields, clicked submit but password field threw “must be between 6-16 characters” error. Reduced password size and clicked submit again. This time got a “duplicate submission, please call a representative at xxx-xxx-xxxx” error. Apparently even though the first submission threw an error on the client side it was nonetheless recorded by AA’s servers. Just for fun tried to login with the creds for the first submission, but didn’t work. So now I basically can’t create an account unless I call AA. I think I’ll just not create an account and avoid flying AA in the future when possible. Pretty lame experience.
title: Couldn’t create account

review:
To all the people that bash this app for completely unrelated reasons like travel delays.... You are being ridiculous. 

This app lets me track flights, book flights, keep me up to date on my exec platinum status, tracks bags and gives up-to-the-minute flight status.   I don’t know how anyone can expect an app to prevent flight delays.   It’s just silly and unrealistic.
title: It does what it should do.

review:
Dear Madam/Sir

Although I’m enjoying generally flying AA, the use of the Admirals Club and the automatic request for upgrades, this last trip had an unexpected surprise for me. On my way to SF my flight from Pittsurgh to JFK was delayed. Nothing wrong with that. These things happen. 

But as a result I was the last one to board the JFK to SFO flight and I saw multiple empty seats on both the first and the business class. And although the AA app was showing me having a “requested” upgrade, this upgrade did not materialize. 

I understand this is s long flight and normally I would not even been placed in the upgrade list. But in that case I was confused as to why although I was in the list and there were empty seats the upgrade did not come through. 

With best regards 
P. Benos
title: Confusing policy

review: We went to baggage claim only to find misinformation about which belt our bag was supposed to be on. We spent more than a half hour wondering which belt was the right one, and then discovered our bag off to the side, with other passengers’ bags. We had no indication that it was there, only that another person mentioned it to us. We then had to wait in a cluster of other people to claim our bag from the attendant. This process should be simple and quick, not aggravating and complicated.
title: Where’s my bag?

review: I just had a flight from MCO-ORD and a passenger in front of us just would not listen to the attendants about keeping his mask on. He arrived wearing a gator mask and was told that was not sufficient and was given a surgical mask. He wore it for about 5-10 minutes and then removed it and never wore it again. The flight attendant mentioned it to him several times but nothing ever came of it. Finally, it was as if they just wanted to ignore him and the situation. If you’re going to enforce this mandate, then enforce it 100% or get rid of the mandate
title: AA passenger not wearing a mask

review: The app is excellent when it’s working properly but it very frequently has errors or glitches for me. I would highly recommend the app still if traveling American, I would just also highly recommend not flying American. After being screwed over countless times (unfortunately I have had to use them for business in the past) I would strongly suggest looking elsewhere
title: App is useful, unfortunately AA isn’t

review: Lost bags. Had to stand in line for over an hour and since I didn’t have all the stickers they hemmed and hawed for another 30 minutes before looking my name up. In Dallas my daughter left her EarPods on the plane, we heard them announce but she didn’t, when we went back 5 minutes later the folks at the gate  were incredibly rude and refused to walk back down to get them for us. The entire trip was one of our worst travel experiences ever. We will be canceling our AA credit card and will never book another flight on American
title: Ridiculous nonsense

review:
Every time I I fly on American Airlines the flights are delayed, canceled, or so late so connecting flights can’t be made. Today was a perfect example of how AA does care about it passengers. My 5:35 AM flight from BNA to DFW was canceled because of bad weather in Dallas TX. 

The funny thing is it was sunny and hot there. Then I was told it was mechanical reasons, and also told it was pilot rest time. Honestly I don’t understand how they stay in business. 

Oh and to top it off my suitcase is missing!!! I guess I need to stick with Alaska Airlines and Delta. At least the care about their clients!!!!
title: American Airlines Missed Their Obligation!

review: Changes too frequently and seems to remove functionality rather than add it.  Very frustrating to not be able to take actions available previously.  Not user friendly- directs to website for seat changes now rather than change within the app like previous versions.  No info on app regarding WiFi or gogo or inflight entertainment unlike the description.  Always forces an update even when international and possibly unable to update iOS to support. Has left me stranded several times
title: Not the best app

review: Almost a 1 Million Miller with this airline but feeling like I have been wasting my whole life doing so because everything keeps getting worse with this airline & their app is a perfect example.  They still utilize old planes with DC power, barely have any racking in the Economy Plus Max seats, & some planes still have DC power requiring you to use a cigarette lighter for power if you have one.  Useless for tracking your bags because it’s never up to date or accurate & the SFO Operations ground crew is the worst laziest & highest paid in the country!
title: Keeps getting worse & NO ME Too Features with other airlines like United :-(

review: I’m attempting to download the app to my smartphone.  I know my Advantage Number but have forgotten my password.  I clicked on the forgot password link that is available within the app.  But it keeps giving me an error.  The app then provided an 800# to call.  So I did.  The call center rep said that the password reset feature doesn’t work in the app.  I need to go to the full website from a computer and not my smartphone.  The rep also said he could not help me.  I’d have to call during regular hours.  Super disappointed and frustrated with the app!!
title: Can’t use app to reset password!?!  Then why is there a link!!!

review:
The American Airlines support service is very power, bad and needs a lot of improvement. This has been a repeated problem with the American Airline crew at the Charlotte airport. A lot of work and reorientation need to be done to the employees here.
We have been in the airplane for about 15 mins without anyone available to operating the gate. Little consideration is paid to people’s time especially those going to work and others with connecting flights.

It’s NEEDS a lot of improvement before you loose your frequent customers
title: Terrible service at Charlotte Airport

review: It is totally impossible to file a claim with AmericanAirlines. One of the questions they ask you for is your ticket number. After I sent,  tried to send pictures of my drivers license and my baggage claim receipt it won’t let me file because it’s asking for a ticket number after they’ve got the record locator and everything else. There is no ticket number on an electronic ticket it only exists on a printed ticket. American is purposely making it difficult, impossible to file a claim.
title: Lost my electric toothbrush by not closing my suitcase after they inspected

review:
The food was not fresh. The salad was wilted and I believed that the broccoli and the rice in which it sat were one second from being spoiled. 

This is not acceptable. The rating is for my overall experience over the past 8 months. I often upgrade to first class. This is the first time the food was not edible. 

Nevertheless, the service is excellent!
title: Food in first class on flight 103 Philadelphia to Phoenix

review:
Had 3 checked bags that were loaded in Honolulu, did not show as arriving in Dallas so they did not arrive at my final destination of Bloomington, IL.  Approx 6 people on our flight without luggage arriving. When we went to counter, representative had to leave to work elsewhere. We were all left at counter (& others arrived to check in for flights) but no one was available to help us. When the representative finally arrived approx 40 min later & in tears, she was helpful but the lack of staff is totally unacceptable. 

As far as the flights, the seats are way too small.
title: Lost luggage

review: Apple or anyone else does not need to know when and where I am traveling. I don’t need or want my boarding passes in Apple Wallet. Boarding passes are to be handled by the airline and the app. Other airlines provide that option. Sharing of that information is a breach of trust and can result in a breach of security or unauthorized disclosure and the users are not aware of the risk of disclosing their flight info. I did not knowingly consent to this and I don’t care if it’s in the EULA but it wasn’t presented to me or the ability to use alternative options.
title: Sharing of Personal Information

review:
Leaving for a business trip this morning and got an email that my 7:30 am direct flight was cancelled and rebooked for tomorrow. No other options from the Greensboro airport to DFW. Tried to call, 4 hour wait on hold. No other choice but book and pay for a one way flight for three of us from Fayetteville, NC to Dallas. They could not give me a refund at the airport. 

Luckily I got here but now how will I get my refund. Total mess and a 4 hour wait on hold got me nothing. Now I’ll be on hold again. Maybe you all should call me? $1100 screw up and will I get a refund??!!
title: Fight cancelled

review: It took 1 hour and 20 minutes to get my bag. They had 10 flights come in and said your bag will either be on carousel 10 or 11. The room was packed. After waiting an 45 minutes both carousels stopped working. It was another 30 minutes before they told us that 4 flights had their bags sent to another terminal. So 600 plus people had to walk to another terminal to get our bags. Total chaos and there was no way to social distance. I’m very disappointed in American. Probably won’t fly with them again and I travel a ton for work.
title: Baggage

review: The app works great but the customer service skills of the employees can by drastically improved upon. I recently bought first class round trip tickets for my wife and I to celebrate our anniversary. Flight got delayed in DFW then finally cancelled. NO ONE and I mean NO ONE from AA was willing to help. I had to pay for a hotel for the night and they wouldn’t even give a food voucher. I just spent $6000 with you and you wouldn’t even give access to the admiral club. On top of it I had to wait 4 hours to get my luggage so I could take medicine that was needed the next day. Not sure if I will ever use American again.
title: App works great

review:
Rudest flight attended I have ever seen was on flight was on 1415 from YVR to DFW today.  And no it was not me she was  rude to but 2 other persons on this flight.  Didn’t catch her name but she was the oldest one there by far.

She could have easily said what she needed to say so much nicer.  Remember you get more ants with honey than vinegar.  

The others and other flight where good if not great.
title: Rudest person I’ve seen in a long time.

review: The flight was great, but when checked bag was returned, the entire back pocket was ripped off. When I asked the gate agent Cody about what had happened and who I need to talk with, he was incredibly confrontational.  He made a scene in front of other customers and said “that’s just what happens when you check bags”. This is unacceptable.  The other women in the bag office were very kind, unfortunately Cody also showed up and continued to aggressively say how I was wrong in pressing for answers to find who was a fault.  It was incredibly frustrating.
title: Checked bag damaged and awful gate agent

review: This app is confusing to use. I tried digging in the app to see how to add my ticket to Apple wallet and I couldn’t find it. After I checked it, it said that I didn’t have a reservation for that day.  I wish they would be all reservations front and center and have an easy “add to apple wallet” option.  Either I’m not using it right or things have changed.
title: Great app very welcoming but...

review: I can’t even create an account to log in. When I put in my address it won’t let me pick which state I live in. If I try and click on it I am prompted “list of states being populated for the first time” then it goes away. No list to view and choose from. If I click on the field again I get the same prompt with the same unfruitful result. Since all fields of information are not complete it will not allow me to complete the process to create an account. Then I read the reviews. Sounds like all the one star reviews made it further than me. It’s a shame I have an Aadvantage card.
title: Garbage

review: I love American, my primary selection for air travel. But ... yep. The customer service, of lack thereof, in St. Croix is excruciating. In over 20 trips in and out of STX,  it once have I encountered a smile or friendly assistance — and I NEVER have special requests or arrangements. I just check my luggage and move on to customs. If I could ask anything of American, please give some serious customer service training to your STX ticketing crew.
title: STX

review:
American’s app is well behind when it comes to certain features compared to the other US based carriers. 

1. There isn’t a way to see the entire seat map. A person on the upgrade list doesn’t have an easy way to see how many seats are available in premium cabins. 

2. Inability to track the specific aircraft location during flight.
title: Needs more features, but typically works well

review:
I had two flights today and neither pushed an alert that they were boarding. 

in addition to the push, the app should display “boarding” instead of “on time” when looking at the flight in the home screen. This will help mirror the flight board on the phone. (and mitigate issues when the push fails.)
title: The Boarding Notification is not Working

review:
Flight search only shows future departures? Not flights that could of been delayed. No info if my flight is on time or where is the aircraft coming from like UA app. No seat map or upgrade list info.
Why should I have to re-enter the city pair
To change search for a different date.
What good is it?
Deleted
United's app remembers all my most recent city pairs for future quick reference.
I would fly Them over AA just so i wouldnt have to use this app.
They have one of the best apps for ease of use and information. Esspecially for frequent upgrades
Why should I have to Log in to check flight status or seat maps or upgrade lists?
Now I am locked out of future updates because I refuse to update my IOS and slow down my device.  “ American airlines- we hate our customers so we give them the most painful onboard and app experiences”
title: 2nd Mostly Useless app

review:
The AA app is fine, it does what it’s supposed to for keeping track of flights.
But what I LOVE is being able to track my luggage.  It will tell you when it’s checked, loaded on the plane, unloaded, and delivered to the baggage carousel.  No wondering and guessing if my luggage made the connection or not.  Very cool!
title: I love being able to track my luggage

review: Love the real time syncing on flight status, ability to track your bags and best of all the ability to ensure that the inbound flight is on time.  I think this is the best of airline apps.  There is something going on with the password that locked me out but I proceeded as a guest and it worked fine.  When I have five hours free to wait on hold, I’ll call the recommended number to unlock my password.
title: Best airline app

review: This app lags so much, and they make it really difficult to redeem your miles. I wish there was a button to just apply your miles to your trip, whether or not you selected that you want to pay with miles before you search. It’s just confusing, and it makes me not want to have the card because they make it difficult.
title: Not user friendly and slow..

review:
I flew in and out DFW to San Diego. 
Flight departed out of terminal c and we arrived back at terminal D at 11:30pm. It took over an hour for the airport shuttle to arrive to take us to the other terminal where we parked. 
WHY DOES AMERICAN SCHEDULE FLIGHTS TO AND FROM DIFFERENT TERMINALS FOR THE SAME FLIGHT DESTINATION?  I could understand if we had these difficulties flying connecting flights or if we had different carriers for departing and arrival. Total incompetence to schedule round trip flights out of different terminals. American is getting too big to pay attention to important details.
title: American flight scheduling is extremely poor

review: I’m trying to get my boarding pass.. Their website and App both are not working. The app sends an email but when I click on that link it doesn’t work at all. It is generating an error saying their “system is having problem and come back later”. Tried so many times. Reached out to Web and Application AA support customer care and they took all my information and they hung up on me without even saying anything. They didn’t gave a call back.
title: Worst service - Couldn’t be able to get my boarding pass

review:
1) Changing destination, arrivals, and dates and researching a couple times normally freezes my app in the loading screen for a new search. 

2) Multi-City and Multi-Day Search should be a fundamental option. I do 50% of my bookings on my phone. The other 50% I do on browser because of this feature missing. 

3) Allow advanced Search Filters, track inputs and leverage the data to know when customers want to fly. 

4) Don’t force Apple Pass Boarding Passes for multi-stop itineraries. I want them loaded and ready to go for when I get to TSA-Pre. 

5) How can I see future routes? Specifically, a list of transatlantic routes in Summer of 2021.  

6) Have the option to put “No Overnight Flights” before hitting search.
title: (Exec Platinum Review) Buggy.

review: The flight was fuller than expected but handled professionally in trying to provide protections. Flight attendants were more active and connecting than I thought they would be from reading new restrictions - in a good way.  My first flight since this started and will try again in the near future.
title: PHX to SAN flight #438

review:
I know American Airlines has had some hard times recently. I believe much of this is related to the consequences of Covid to people and our society. Nonetheless, you're still a great organization and I believe you're doing the best you can. 
Had a great trip to Miami today. Thank you that is working well for me.
title: Times are Tough

review:
Worst experience may I start with. I been flying with America Airlines for a while but this flight was beyond the worst. It was hot, packed especially with Covid going on. I was shock how packed it was and hot! To add the restroom were dirty! As well when ask if I can be moved since passenger in front of me had two empty seats as I sat between two people as well the seats towards the back were empty and per flight attendant stated they had to keep those seats empty. I’ve never experienced such experiences, maybe by spirit flight but not AA. 

The only positive the flight attendants did offer a cold pack of ice to cool down. Wow!
title: Over packed, Hot.....Worst Experience!

review: My husband and I arrived Phoenix airport he flying to Reno me to Washington DC for work conference today accidentally  had his bag and it was checked to Washington DC Reagan airport when we realized bags got switched panicked American baggage team was AMAZING they were able to pull husband bag Re-route to Reno and the he checked my bag to Washington DC huge shoot out to American Baggage and ticket team   Thank you
title: Baggage in Phoenix

review: Not sure what the issues are for the other users. I fly Delta, AA and SWA all the time. This app just pulled my next four flights, seating charts and boarding pass for my next flight without any issues. The interface is fast and works great. This is similar to the experience I have with the other airline apps. I’m using and iPhone X with iOS 13.1.
title: Works great for me

review:
Boarding the plane and de boarding a plane is no different than Covid. 

Boarding-People standing in the isle, first class first, nothing really changed 

De-boarding- people stand up as soon as the plane stops, people trying to pass each other in the isle

I’ve traveled 2x on delta recently. The back of the plane boards first going towards the front. 1st class was seated last. Then when de-boarding it’s was from front to back except you can’t get up until the row in front of you is already walking away. They monitored this closely and if needed they told people to sit back down. I flew 1st class on both delta flights and was completely happy with how the boarding went as if I boarded first then everyone walks past me. 

I suggest taking a flight on delta from Chicago to NY. 7am daily
title: Travel during Covid

review:
American flies a lot places I want to go. I used to be status on both American and Delta. However, overtime the service was noticeably lower. From rude flight attendants to dirty bathrooms that were not serviced prior to the flight. I not logged complaints, but did choose Delta as my preferred airline. Today, my son and I were in group 6. Just before boarding, an announcement was made that the rest of us needed to check bags. 

To my dismay, there were at least 5 empty bins. In addition, checked bags had to be retrieved at baggage claim and not even curbside, which further delayed us. 

I took a video.
title: I’ve Tried

review: If everything goes exactly as planned, it works ok. I had canceled flights. It wouldn’t show my new flight to give me a boarding pass. Also, it sent me to VeriFLY for a trip from Charlotte NC to Raleigh, NC. Goes crazy on notifications—I don’t need to know 10 times that my flight arrival has changed by 3 minutes. Good for tracking your bag. Sometimes ok for changing flights or seats. Needs some work.
title: Doesn’t handle changes well.

review: Our son gave us our tickets! We generally travel on Southwest. However, we really enjoyed our flights from Tampa to Nashville and back. The staff was very friendly. I forgot my iPad in the seat back when I deplaned. The attendant at the desk quickly retrieved it & wished me a Merry Christmas. I will be sure to travel AA again. Merry Christmas! 🎄
title: Nashville

review:
Origin flight on itinerary UVPPMK departing on 1/26 was cancelled with little notice- about 1hr before departure. rerouted flights resulted in missed connection, while luggage was sent ahead on flights we were not on. We wasted a vacation day spending 12 hrs getting from PNS to DFW, and ended up with extra expense of a hotel in Dallas and without luggage so we can get the first flight out on 1/27. Hopefully flight 1863 leaves on time and is without issues. 
Overall very disappointed.
title: Flight cancellation/ rebooking issues

review: I checked into my flight way easier on this app than I did on the computer. It’s super intuitive and you can tell they put some work into it. It even has airport maps for where you’re going and coming from. Breath of fresh air compared to the trash delta app.
title: Great!!

review: First off this app works about 1 out of 10 flights and continually spams the messages “can’t communicate with server” and or “can’t access your account” although online I can sign in with no issues. Not only this but when I get email reminders, the link opens their website, not this app, then instead of having an eticket ready on my app, I have to go to the website and either download a pdf and print tickets or screenshot part of my ticket and hope it scans at the airport because we all know the app isn’t going to work!
title: Never works! Junk app.

review: It was a great flight round trip. This is the first time on American Airlines and I would fly it again. The planes were very clean. The online check in system was excellent. The pilot was very informative keep you aware of what was going on as well as their online app.I would recommend American Airlines.
title: First time flier on American Airlines

review: We have a flight scheduled from 5:20pm, 1/8/22 and was delayed to 6:35pm. We got onboarded and waited more than 2 hours inside the plane and decided to remove all of us and decided to cancel our flight. They don’t even offer or advise about booking a hotel since our possible next flight is the following day. Not even offer some food and just handed us a note about the steps on how to rebook. Did not give us any information as well  about our suite case. I don’t know where it is at now. Worst flight ever!
title: Cancelled Flight

review: My phone doesn’t support iOS 13.0. When asked if I want to download the latest version of the app supported by my phone it tells me my phone doesn’t support 13.O and asks would I like to download the latest app supported. There is no way out of this loop other than to cancel. I had this issue in June but at least it allowed me to download and run the latest version that worked. Now that doesn’t work. Apparently the AA app will now only support phones with 13.0 or greater. I’m not buying a new phone just so I can run AA’s app.
title: Infinite update loop

review: I have been using this app for a while now very easy to navigate. I have booked flights, changed flights, and used many of the services through the app. When my kids fly I use there number to log in to watch their flights.
title: Flying all the time

review:
First the good part- it hasn’t crashed yet and it shows the basic information I needed. That’s about it. 

UI of this app is incredibly bad and primitive. Minimum useful features and basically just bare bones. What should deserve negative stars is the login page. FFS I had to go to my computer and change my password to a short one because this app is not only unfriendly towards password managers but also you cannot paste passwords. At some length (around 16 or 18) characters it straight up stops showing what you type!
title: So bad...

review:
Updated March 17: make this three flights in the last three months the app can’t check in. 

When is AA going to invest in some decent testing?? 

Original: The app sends a notification on my phone that it’s time to check in for my flight. But when I go through all the steps to actually check in, the app gives me a generic (i.e. unhelpful) error message that the check in is no long available. (hours before my flight) Second time in two flights that this has happened.
title: Can’t check in

review: If you try to go and change your flight through the app, often times the slide up menu (you see at the bottom with “Seats”) will get in the way of you hitting the continue button within another screen. I’ve had to go back and forth and re-select my change flight about 3 times now and right when I’m about to confirm it the slide up menu pops up again blocking me from continuing on. Please fix!
title: Annoying glitch

review: I enjoyed my journey tremendously.  The ground staff was amazing, they treated my mom, who needed wheelchair assistance, well.  The crew was extremely professional and the flights themselves were smooth and stress free.  We arrived in Tulsa early which was a bonus for us.  Keep up the good work American Airlines you’ve gained two passengers forever!!!
title: First American Airlines flight

review: Besides the check in and tickets, this app also tells you where your next gate is, and the baggage claim carasol number to claim your baggage. It also tracks each scan of the bags so you know they made it in the plane.  You can choose seats as well. This is very helpful.
title: Nice App and it actually works!

review:
Booked my flights and seats 6 weeks in advance. Out-bound gate was changed at the last minute and had to transfer to another terminal. Returning flight my seat was changed 90 mins before depature with no explanation. Thank God the head flight attendant had mercy on me an found another seat closer to my family, although not my original seat. Upon arrival our checked bag was lost and no one at baggage claim could give us a straight, honest answer.
I’ll be shopping for another airline. Boo on you Ametican. You’re better than this.
title: Review

review: Thank you for keeping us safe and flying during Covid.  The flight attendants and everyone have been great at ensuring people are following guidelines.  Almost all flights have been on time.  Will be happy to see more flights return for easier travel for this weekly road warrior.
title: Flying During Covid

review: The latest update requires iOS of 13 or higher... so now the American Airlines app no longer works on most devices in circulation. Our family has iPhone 6s & 7s... your app can no longer be updated as these devices are iOS 12....so the app no longer works at all! HUGE oversight by your dev team and disappointing for sure.
title: App Update A Disaster for Many

review: I didn’t get notifications from the agent during our conversation. The app/website would not let me ask a “new” question, or exit out of the unanswered communication, even though she said she had left. Now I am on the phone waiting longer than an hour for the same feedback and to hopefully get an answer this time around.
title: Worked fine until…

review: The app works a lot faster than many other airlines, but as soon as you try to do anything on it, it starts freezing up. Flight credits to use? Good luck. Call in with a 3 hour wait time. Not to mention the hurdles AA has put in place to use your flight credits. If I buy a one way trip from Argentina, my future credit can only be used FROM Argentina! What good is that if I’m a full time American resident? Predatory terms, useless app, terrible customer service. Will not be using American ever again. Good riddance.
title: Seems useful at first

review: The basics of the app are great but beyond that safe yourself the time and use their website or worse call their service department.   Their app shows options to upgrade but when you try to take advantage of them they error out. Error messages are unclear what the issue is. Every time it requires a call to their help desk only to find out their app is wrong.
title: Glitches Left and Right

review:
The app has a polished and cool look.
But it could be more user friendly.
It is difficult to easily access baggage information, limits, regulations and costs.
Also, using the in-flight entertainment, during the flighty, was inefficient.
I followed all the steps, but was not able to access the “free in-flight entertainment”.
title: Looks good could be better

review:
Me: 3+ flight delay because of crew issues

AA app: you’re going to miss your connection, change your connecting flight click here

Me: tries to change flight for next day

AA app: sorry no flights available 

Me: hmm plenty of flights, goes to customer services , rebooked for next day flight

Me: tries to get seat on app

AA app: sorry see agent at gate

Me: goes to customer service next day to get seat assignment 

Customer Service: no I can’t. Go see a gate agent

Me: you’re not a agent?

Customer Service: nope

Me: my bad. You’re not customer service?

Customer Service: <stares>

Me: tries app again

AA app: now I let you check-in and get your seat

Me: this will be my last flight on AA, hope they don’t lose my bag.
title: Non-functional rebooking flights

review: The new requirements for face coverings andno longer allowing neck gaiters and ither are not scientifically backed. Most face barriers including cheap papercovers are not a protective material that stops viruses. Id like to see facts used when requiring medical devices that are in capable of stopping viruses and actuallyincrease risk of cross contamination. As a bio ethicist id VB like to remind you of the duty you have to use facts and not hysteria. Other than that the Team was great
title: Excessive

review: You would think that in a pandemic they would care more about health than money 😭. Lies. Every flight is always completely full and then you end up having to “check” your carryon if you are in a later boarding group. Why advertise as one FREE personal item and carry on and then make customers pay to check their bags. I’ll stick to Southwest and Delta, even Spirit if I’m desperate.
title: They’re okay!

review:
I had a connection flight from PR in Miami.  When I got to the counter t
The attendant Natalie told me I arrived to late.  It was 15 mins until the flight left and she told me to talk to a manger.  When I spoke to the manager he stated I had to be boarded 15 mins before the flight left. I told him I was there.  He stated that he couldn’t open the flight and for me to rebook.  I understand the process but I don’t understand why I wasn’t allowed to board.  I understand where I stand as a customer with American Airlines going forward
title: Worst flight experience.

review: This app has great features, but often fails to work properly. Yesterday, I tried three times to purchase a flight. I’d get all the way to the end and then receive a “please start over” message. I finally had to switch to the website to complete my purchase. I’ve also found that the back button often doesn’t work for me.
title: Useful but buggy

review: American garbagelines is actually the worst airlines in existence. They have the most uncomfortable seats, the rudest/worst flight attendants, and the worst customer service. On top of that, every other airline offers some sort of option for their cheapest non-refundable ticket options. Southwest and delta will at least give you a voucher. I will go out of my way to pay extra for any other airline, which honestly doesn’t always happen because other airlines often have better fares.
title: The worst airlines in existence.

review:
Every single time I open the app, I get repeated notifications about “changes” to my departing flight, when nothing has changed. My iCal constantly has an “unread” bubble indicating that I haven’t opened something.

Separately, also think it would be amazing if this app showed recent activity (so that I could see which of my recent trips was already counted toward my account) and the number of EQM/EQD I stand to earn from each saved itinerary.
title: Help!

review: Booked flight early in the year, then COVID hit. They will not refund my money and forcing me to fly before end of next year. My wife and I cannot afford to do anything by that time frame as she lost her job. American does not care and will not refund, but other companies understand and are. I still have to fly due to work, there is zero social distancing on jet bridge and when boarding. The do not take this serious at all, flights are packed!
title: Horrible customer service

review: My last name has 21 characters. Some genius in the mobile app team decided that there needs to be a limit of 20 characters on the last name. Now I can’t even log in to the app. What’s funny is that their mobile website doesn’t have this limitation. I think American truly lives up to its name with its disregard for other cultures. Can you please ask your engineers to use their flight benefits and fly to places outside Texas? There’s a big wide world out there where everyone is not named John Smith. Think about them before you design your app.
title: Really poorly designed

review: This app is lightyears behind the United Airlines version, the two airlines I fly regularly, not up mention the Delta app).  The site makes me login in repeatedly, and to make it worse, won’t recognize my security question answers when I go through this process.  Linking back to the AAdvantage page requires an additional login (how about investing in a seamless user interface???). The flight info is always delayed - I get the info significantly faster from the gate reps, which is hard to imagine.  It’s a waste of an app and a shame American is so significantly outclassed by its peers.
title: Lousy App

review: How people can complain about this app I have no clue.  I believe hands down this is the best app ever.  American makes it easy to track my bags.  Keeps me updated on the gates and automatically changes my gate and seat updates.  One can easily spot changes because the app circles them.  I love AA and appreciate this app so much!  Thanks to the developers! Great job!!!
title: Simply the best!

review:
Really up to date app with real-time information. 
You can always track your bags, get immediately all info (like which baggage claim to go), and even can change your flights. 
Just one click away. 
I love this airline app. Best compare to others.
title: Outstanding App

review: If I could give this app zero stars I would. Used to work great but now in the past year or so, I’ve yet to successfully book a flight from start to finish without the system glitching or app crashing and having to start over and then usually getting an error or worse a price increase next time I attempt to book because of it. I’m a very loyal AA flyer and these mobile app issues lately are enough to make me want to fly Southwest… AA mobile dev team - Seriously, do better.
title: Crashes constantly

review:
Traveling from Cancun to Dallas and I have completed all the VeriFLY steps and have been provided with a valid pass for both myself and my companion.  This means I have uploaded my vivid test results. 

Yet the app will not let me check in and states one of the two passengers is incomplete (when I’m complete).  Not looking forward to waiting in line needlessly.

My first time flying with AA, likely will avoid in the future given this experience.  There is no reasonable way to obtain technical support without being 45th in line for text customer service. 

Otherwise for domestic use the app, maybe it’s better? Yet even when departing for Mexico from the US, the upload passport function didn’t work either. 

Too many bugs and hurdles.
title: VeriFLY doesn’t work causes headaches

review: Arrived to our destination and the bags were missing and according to the careless attendant at the baggage claim he doesn’t know anything and after we insist we get an answer we said it was arriving tomorrow to the airport. We have to work at 5AM and we have no work clothes with us! This is ridiculous, not only we filed a form to get our bags delivered they also said at the baggage claim that we need to come and pick them up, because they are not delivering anything! What a BAD EXPERIENCE! Starting from the horrible customer service !
title: Missing bags

review:
Thank you once again American for making my travels a complete nightmare! You seem to once again provide horrible customer experience.
Second time in a month you managed to not get my bag to my destination with me!
Sad to say, you are losing a customer! 
Plus I will make sure all of my coworkers who travel daily also hear about this along with social media!
You would think in times like these you would go above and beyond to keep the customers that continued to be loyal to you!!!
title: Thank you!

review: This is an extremely difficult app to use. You use these apps do you don’t have to print out a boarding pass. But this app makes it difficult to get your boarding pass - especially if you’re traveling in a group. You can’t get your pass unless everyone is checked it. And once everyone is checked in it’s impossible to get a boarding pass. Just plain ridiculous. Even the “second tier” and “third tier” airlines do this better than AA.
title: Difficult to get a boarding pass

review: I made my reservation with the app!  When I needed to inquire on a change the chat feature gave me access to an agent right away!  And when I travel the track your bag feature is really helpful knowing my belongings made the connections!  Love the app!!
title: Everything you Need!

review: It should be easier to change seats.  On other apps for competitors such as Delta, it takes one tap to access the seat map.  I’m not sure why the AA app requires you to tap on your seat, where it opens a new browser window, then re-tap your seat again to finally access the seat map.  It’s over complicated, slow, and not user friendly.
title: Seat Change Problems

review:
I strongly stress to not only simplify the eCredit on both the full website and the app.
I understand that the airline likely want additional revenue, but not at the expense of customers. I feel and believe that repeat customers and word of mouth is best and customers as a partner and not revenue generator. 
Please consider your customers.
title: eCredits

review: Sorry American but this round trip was very disappointing! Departure flight—-American changed our departing flight to a 2 hour later flight, we boarded then had the unboard and walk 30 gates to a new flight. So we got to Tampa almost 5 hours later than we wanted. Then on our way back to Dallas, American changed our flight to 5 hours earlier than the original. We tried to change flights but we couldn’t. So thanks American, our vacation was cut very short. NOT HAPPY.
title: Bad experience all the way around

review: This app is great—real time information with boarding passes gate info and luggage tracking. Also easy and instant access to terminal maps. Plus ability to request upgrades and change seats or flights without need to wait in a line or call. If you fly American Air, you need this app.
title: Great app for frequent traveler

review: I fly almost weekly for my job and American is unfortunately the predominant airline at my home airport. Not only are they a horrendous airline to fly but this app is the worst. I use Delta, Southwest and United as much as possible and their apps are easy, intuitive and unlike AA’s functional. I have a flight today. Does it show that in the AA app?  No!!!  Are you kidding?  It is actually easier to go online to their equally awful mobile site to check in for a flight. If you have to fly American you might as well have the app - just know it is HORRIBLE!
title: Worst Airline App Bar None

review: While the app works well, I would say a big piece missing from the full site is easy flight and seat availability.  As a very frequent flyer, I use this function very often and always have to go to the full site.  Please make this addition!  Thank you!
title: Works well, needs more functionality

review:
Domestic flight: I checked in for a flight then tried to pay to upgrade my seat. The app allows me to change seats but then will not process the payment. Error message is not helpful.

International flight: when returning from Greece to the US, the AA app asked me to upload my COVID documents. None of that helped me when I boarded.
