The gate agent asked if I used verifly (I did not since I was prompted to upload to the AA app) and then I had to search for the original copies of our COVID tests.
title: Need to fix seat change and COVID document upload

review:
I know enough to know that this is not directly the app’s fault here, but I believe the webplayer is broken on iOS devices running the new safari  for iOS 15+. None of the content was able to be played during my flight (AA2184).

I tried on both 
iPhone 13 Pro on iOS 15
iPhone 12 Pro on iOS 15.0.2

Same results for both. I would get on the wifi, be able to navigate through all the video content, view all the commercials leading up to the video, only to end up with an endless loading video player when it came time to watch the movie. I tried with many different thpes of content with no luck.

Its strange because the trailers worked for each movie. Other user around me on older iOS devices running earlier versions of iOS worked fine.
title: Videos did not work during flight

review: They do not let you cancel or change flights for there only affordable tickets even with everything happening with covid. The country I was going to changed there vaccination laws and not in time to even get vaccinated before my trip and American Airlines will not do anything for me. So I just lost 650 dollars. They wont even give vouchers or let you switch flights to an instate place. I know airlines are hurting but taking peoples money is not the way to keep customers in the future.
title: Dont buy American airline

review: Wow, just, wow. I’ve never dealt with such a poorly designed app by a major carrier! Tried booking a flight using the app, but I’d to update my selections multiple times before it would even let me proceed. Then, when I finally reached the payment screen, I foolishly assumed that the available PayPal option would work. NOPE! It generates an error that makes me start the entire process all over again! If there were ANY other airlines flying to my destination, I would choose one of them!
title: Can’t pay for my flight?

review:
Wife was traveling alone and was already nervous. Landed in Philly, went to gate the app told her and settled in for the hour wait. Got nervous when it was getting close to boarding time and there were no gate agents or pilots so she went to another gate to check...they told her her aircraft had been changed to one terminal over. She runs to other terminal just to find the aircraft has left early. No announcement over the Soeakers...didn’t even bother to have anyone at the old gate make an announcement. 

They tell you to trust their app...DON’T.
title: DO NOT TRUST THIS APP

review: Every since downloading recent update the app keeps crashing when I try to access the menu with WiFi/entertainment!!   I have uninstalled and reinstalled and reset my phone.  No luck. Now I’m on business flights and can’t access WiFi. Major problem!!
title: Problems with update

review:
2 different agents on the phone told me I would not be charged for my checked bags (credit card holder). One of those was on speaker phone in front of the gate agent who wanted to charge me for my bags. I asked for a supervisor and nothing changed. I was told because these agents were not under her supervision she could not do anything. I would have to file a claim.  
Flights cancelled due to maintenance on what I’m told is one of the busiest days (end of Holiday Break) per the agent. Why would you schedule maintenance on one of the busiest days of the year?
title: Misinformation and cancelled flights

review: Unless it's broken on my  app some basic functionality is missing - ability to see full seat map, not just booked class of service (helpful if on upgrade wait list); no ability to see upgrade wait list or available sold/checked in/available for upgrades. Gives me the ability to click on 'Upgrades' on day of flight but just tells me 'Requested' and how  many 500 mile certs are needed.   Crazy that United app has provided these functions for years!
title: Serious functionality improvements needed

review:
Claims that only 13.0. IOS or higher to update. Yet, claims it has applicable lateral platform. Ahhhh no it doesn’t! Nice roll out. 
Way to go AA glad to see people aren’t doing their job and supervisors are checking up on the work. Happy to hear AA is running you only had 18 months to figure it out.
title: Terrible app

review: Bells and whistles are nice, but I want to use an airline app for two main purposes: 1) check into my flight 2) have an electronic boarding pass. In spite of getting a notification from the app to check into my flight, the option is nowhere to be found in the app. Worse, when I expect to be able to pull my boarding pass up, I get repeated errors and end up having to waste time going to a kiosk. I’m honestly debating just deleting the app because it’s currently serving no purpose other than to take up space on my phone.
title: Worthless app

review: I never cared for American Airlines now I don't care for their app.  It is almost totally worthless.  Can't locate the flight it says I have and can't even bring it up manually.  The only reason I fly American is because of others booking my flights for me. I guess refusing to fly American is my only option. It has my record for months, then all of a sudden it says it can’t locate the record, “check your name spelling,etc.  What a joke!  Now keep getting ERROR 500 Server not responding when I ‘m trying to get my reservation.  Just a really BAD app.
title: Worthless

review:
Maintenance on aircraft at ORD, so delayed it in Fargo because the plane will not arrive on time, (delayed about two hours), and this is a small six gate airport so not much to do, eat or drink. These small CRJ jets run Mesa airlines or others always appear to have some kind of maintenance issues…customers/passengers shouldn't have to pay the price for mediocrity, but we do because we don't have any choice, after the fact.

Landing safe is paramount to all air travel but 
prevention is key to convenience and making connecting flights.
title: Fargo

review: I fly extremely often and American Airlines va. Testify to that . I flew with whatever airline had the cheapest rate . I’ve found that the initial Price isn’t all inclusive such as Americans and the quality of flight and overall experience is superior to any other airline . Lounges , staff, and airplanes are all A+ for us
title: The best airline

review:
Sad to see a great airline go downhill like that! American Airlines has gone to the nastiest place in terms of customer service including their mobile app! They cancel flights and reschedule you for days later as if they can control your life! Their wait times are longer than 12 hours and when you get hold of someone they can’t help you! 
They cut flights and jobs but somehow they still get paid by the government! 
Corrupt organizations with corrupt operations! Beware of scam!!!
title: Worst airline and worst customer service

review: I have to say I love this app!  It reminds you about your flight, gate number updates, and boarding updates. Very easy to find all the info I needed,  even gives you baggage claim info and you can tracking.  You can see your seat assignment and change it if desired.  I had a wonderful experience with AA.
title: App review

review: upon arriving in philadelphia on flight 4854 on dec. 22, passengers were forced to wait outside on the tarmac for their checked bags..i was ok because i had a jacket, but there were children and elderly out there shivering..one older woman said to me, “i have no thyroid, so i freeze up immediately.” ...that was a little more information than i needed, but you get the point..when a ticketing agent from inside the gate pointed out to one of the tarmac workers how wrong this was, the worker shrugged and said, “i’m cold too.”...the problem with that argument was that she knew she’d be standing in 20 degree weather..most of these passengers did not and were not dressed for it.
title: phl arrival

review:
Updated to 13.2 Per the Apple and boarding pass STILL not populating on lock screen. Sent a note to AA and they played dumb, not heard of it. Paruse the reviews. Big issue with no fix in place. Shame. 

Is it just me or are others who upgraded to iOS 13 not getting their boarding pass on their lock screen. I have all the correct settings and have installed and deleted the app. Still no pass on lock screen. Affecting my 7 and 11 pro both on iOS 13. Worked perfectly on iOS 12.
title: Boarding pass not on lock screen

review: The app runs fine the flight attendants are nice as well as staff.I tried to get my flight changed to the following morning due to weather delays and not even there staff could change my ticket at the airport he was on call with customer service ( which would take two hours) and did not give me any vouchers. They have turned a 4 hour trip into a 12 hour. When all they had to do was switch me to tommorrow. It seems like corporate want to push responsibility to the employees and employees want to push responsibilities to corporate
title: Greed

review: I lost my billfold on the AA flight from DFW to Kalispar MT. The manager of the AA operation in Kalispar  alley and emailed me to make sure I knew they had it. When I arrived to check in at the terminal, the friendly ticket agents said Hi Mr Keathley, we have a package for you and it was my billfold !  Then the flight back to DFW left on time and arrived early. Great customer service !  AA is my favorite airline.
title: Best employees

review: No major problems. Quick updates. Lots of options. A great deal of information and resources available. My only beef is I shouldn’t have to request the system give me miles credit for completed trips. Every time I complete a trip it should automatically update those.
title: Overall Very Good

review: It’s a good enough app, though there are a few minor things.  Sometimes the boarding pass gets stuck and won’t update.  If you have a very short trip (same day or quick overnight) you can’t check in for your return until your outbound segment completes.  And you can’t book multi city, have to go to the website.
title: Wish I could book multi city

review: It deserves no star employees are very rude and don’t care, my flight changed gate 4 times departures time changed 8 times.  Crew was saying the reason for delay is fixing the plain taking longer. I ask don't you have another plain they say no, I don’t know, I am telling you what I see etc.. no one was saying we are sorry passenger suffer over 6 hours delay and dealt with unprofessional crew. McDonald’s can respond better just for wrong made hamburger than aa responded the problem we went trough today
title: Worst airline

review: I’ve flown so much I’ve gotten platinum pro. Have been slightly frustrated that American will have their flight attendants walk the aisles doing ‘mask checks’ but won’t have a traditional beverage service. One would think service would be at the forefront for those of us who are still flying with them. Flying is safe, people. I’ve never seen the airlines clean their planes so much
title: Platinum pro during a pandemic

review:
Unfortunately for me - I fly American pretty frequently. At least enough to maintain Gold status with them annually. But this app is borderline useless 50% of the time: change seats only for it not to count. Flights disappear from your account, updates stop coming on your upcoming trip. It’s almost like it’s managed out of the local elementary school and not a multi billion dollar company. 
Save yourself the trouble - consider another airline and get a better app and travel experience.
title: Find another airline

review: I was loving this app until it had my husband and I walking around the airport looking for our luggage! We were in Terminal C, the app said our luggage was in Baggage Claim E! PLEASE DO NOT ASSUME assume that everyone knows that means Carousel E!! Philadelphia Airport is huge, so you can imagine the frustration from coming from a long trip to have to walk back and forth. I even asked one of the workers and they were confused as well! We finally found our luggage in lost and found!! 😠
title: PLEASE Be Clear on Baggage Claim!!!

review:
This app is a great travel companion. I get push notifications of upcoming flight, notices to check in, notices within 2 hours of boarding. It is really nice when I get the occasional seat change upgrade to first class. 

The free in-flight entertainment through the app make long and short flights bearable.
title: Outstanding app

review:
This was, at one time, probably the best airline app available in terms of comprehensiveness, timeliness and ease of use.

That all went out the window in mid-2020 when the company inexplicably began sending notifications to your phone for promotional messages. And there is no way to opt out of only the advertisements, so you must resort to the option of disabling all notifications, including flight delays and gate changes, too.
title: Promotional notifications

review:
When I check my seat assignment to see if I may get an upgrade via my status (by counting the number of empty first class seats vs. my place on the upgrade list), I wish you’d show me all cabins, not just mine (economy). 
Sometimes, I want to pay for the upgrade and I have to pretend to “book” a flight in order to check first class availability.
title: Great new updates, but...

review: The app is nice to use but very inconsistent with real time updates. Your flight could be delayed and the app doesn’t inform you until well after the delay has taken place. I also does not recognize when you have changed your flight or gotten on a new flight standby. The app also has issues with seat maps when you change your flight. Seems like the app is okay but there are broader data issues within American Airlines
title: Inconsistent

review: Your customer service is a joke.  Also your airline cancelling a flight a minute after boarding is supposed to start leaving people with no options and with the BS excuse of weather when there isn’t weather anywhere that your planes are coming from.   I am done flying this crap hole airline that doesn’t seem to have answers to anything but a lot of excuses. Same old same old American what a absolute joke of an airline service.  There should be a no star option to pick from
title: Customer service is horrible

review: I grew up in Canada and in high school, our airlines had in-flight screens, this was 2004....why do new planes in 2019 not have screens in the US?! They don’t tell you in advance that when you get on the plane, there won’t be screens and then they tell you to download the app...problem is you don’t have WiFi and their in-flight WiFi does not work to download apps. Now you’re stuck on a plane for hours with nothing in 2019. Seriously? No one wants this app. Just have screens like every other country.
title: No one wants this app for in flight entertainment

review:
Very convenient for keeping track of upcoming flights, boarding times and for checking in.  

Could do more.  For example seat map only has the class of service you are in which isn’t helpful if you are looking at possible upgrades.
title: Does what it does well but wish had a few more features

review: I have used app for last two years on my iPad , and it had worked flawlessly. Recently opened app, and had update software message. I updated. After update, app did not work at all. Literally, I could not do anything. I deleted the app, and reinstalled, to no avail. I updated iOS operating system. No dice. I called the help desk a week ago, and they were unable to help. Technical support was supposed to contact me, and as of this writing, I have not heard a thing.
title: Updated Version doesn’t work at all.

review:
I am an EP and have been using the app for a number of years.  The update you just did requires iOS 13.  I use an older iPhone 6 because it still works.
Now it looks like I’ll have to spend $600 on a new phone to use the app.  Poor planning.
title: New app needs iOS 13

review: App help was no help and didn’t even know what I was talking about. On main page of your reservation usually gives me the option to click to map from my location to the airport. Something it gives me the option, sometimes it don’t. It even gives you the time it takes to get to airport. I want this option every time.  The App help said there is no such thing but if you open the setting on the app and click on locations, it states below that the app will give you directions to airport.
title: Map to airport

review: I am currently sitting in the DFW airport. The App is reporting that the flight is delayed but Boarding occurred 30 minutes earlier. The people working the desk announced that the Co-Pilot would not arrive until almost 30 minutes after the time posted for the delayed departure but they didn’t want to update the time. What sense does that even make. What use is the App if the times are manipulated to deliver misinformation. Just as a side note the Boarding of the plane did not occur at the reported time as we are all sitting at the gate.
title: App does not update the actual time

review: Kept crashing every time I tried checking in. I am currently abroad and only have access to a phone in order to check in. Had to download the app because the website was not compatible and completely non functional on a phone. First time time using this airline and most likely my last. Most complicated and intricate check in process ever. Took me an unbelievable amount of time to get the app to work long enough to check in.
title: Lacks function

username: i miss the old sim city
review: App does not allow you to easily use e credits with out giving errors most of the time.  App also will not let you make multiple reservations under the same name for same day.  App can be likes to say you have a duplicate purchase when shopping different flights and going back to original flight to purchase.
title: Buggy app

review: Due to Covid cancellations for my work I needed to buy a second flight on American the same day. (First class no less) when I went to check in the agent said I could not check my bag to my final destination because it was on two tickets. (Both American Airlines) I had to claim my bag in Chicago, then recheck and go back through security.  They used to do it. Other airlines do it. Do much for customer service.  Luckily there are other airlines.
title: Baggage issues

review: Been trying to upload this app to my phone. After filling out the registration form and then hitting submit, it says A VALID PHONE NUMBER IS 10 DIGITS. I double checked, triple checked, the number I put in IS EXACTLY 10 digits long. It’s all digits only, no spacing, no dashes, no extra anything. Seems to me to be very bad program mess up. Tried computer, iPad, different phone.... Has this issue ever been addressed? How does anybody get this app if this basic registration thing is not fixed, can’t register? Is there something I’m not seeing? How do you fix this? Help!
title: Invalid number!?

review: Please fix whatever you did to the ipad version with the last update. My iphone app looks and works the same but the ipad is now completely different. It’s is difficult to view, freezes randomly and makes it difficult to update trips (meaning they don’t update when one swipes down on them). Please fix this! It is a frequent source of frustration for me. Apps should facilitate tasks, not make them more difficult.
title: Last update terrible on ipad

review:
I flew 2x19 hrs on 4 AA flights in the last week. All advertised having movies that can be watched on this app. None of the flight I was able to see a single movie. 

The comedy is that when you click on “Wi-Fi and free entertainment” on the app, it sends you to Safari, where you browse the movie catalog in their in flight captive portal. Then you decide which movie to play, tap on it and you’re sent back to the app! And of course the movie doesn’t start. Majestic fail :)

I tried on two different phones and an iPad, same result. 

Why 2 stars? The app allows you to quickly see, change, upgrade seats. At least some value...

Don’t depend on AA app for in flight entertainment, bring your own entertainment on board. Especially in painful long AA flights in old airplanes.
title: App design to frustrate

review:
Be very careful using this airline in general I was a frequent flyer with this airline and purchased a ticket a few min utes later i realized it was the day before my plan departure Minutes after I attempt to rearrange my transportation with the guarantee and paid for incurrence I was still charged for the flight I officially booked which was over $500
I also had to book another flight for my passenger I eventually had to go to my bank and dispute these charges which are still under investigation
title: I had to dispute there in adequate charges

review: American Airlines says that you need this app to watch movies on your phone over WIFI. That was my main reason for downloading it. Well, so far I was not able to watch anything. The player is not working and the only way I can watch movies is on my laptop. Apparently on my last flight no one was able to get the app to work. So really the only thing I can use the app for is the check in - something I can easily do on AA website. Thus, pretty useless app.
title: Pretty useless

review:
For several iterations now, the app begins to slow down significantly and starts to freeze shortly after beginning to use. When I type in a character on the keyboard, it takes a few seconds before it appears and eventually freezes. Been using AA online website instead until the app is fixed. 
iPhone X ios 15.3.1.
title: Slow

review:
Would give 5 stars as I normally fly AA but this flight I just felt like the male flight attendant was not having a good day or he just doesn’t know how to smile and be kind and hospitable. Sort felt like he had issue with lead flight attendant as she was emptying a tray of trash I turned to him for water and was like that’s her🙄. And for such a long flight over water there should be more than just a cookie or pretzels. 
LA_Red
title: HNL to LAX

review: This app offers ZERO actual help when you need it. My flight has been cancelled twice and while I’m able to get an email letting me know this information, I can’t see any real time/accurate upcoming flight information in the app to try and rebook as a reasonable option. Example: it’s showing flight options from the previous day. In addition, it’s very slow and clunky.
title: Clunky and slow

review: The app is often glitchy and annoying, giving error messages that make no sense and clicking links that lead to nowhere. Also it’s requiring me to download verifly to check into my app. So now I need two apps to check into a flight? Also the first review of Verifly is obviously a paid review, just like the first review on American “I recently traveled” “for my most recent trip” “the trip I just went on” cmon start with a different opener it might be less obvious
title: Glitchy and annoying

review:
Spent over 2 hours doing all the COVID stuff with VeriFLY for my family of 5. Only to find out that you have to check in at the desk if you have a lap infant. Why did it waste my time! The lap infant was on the reservation from the beginning!

Very frustrating. 

And to make it worse when I was checking in the desk agent just laughed at my ‘ready to fly’ pass at the desk. She had no idea what that was and it saved me no time at all. Just wasted my time completely.
title: Cannot check in via app with lap infant

review:
So you would think that most people would be using an airline app to access their boarding pass electronically so theoretically, it should be the EASIEST thing to find on an app, right?

Nope, American Airlines App doesn’t provide any links for your boarding pass on the app and doesn’t have a search feature. The best they have is their chat bot which only links to the (bad and incomplete) instructions on how to access the boarding pass on the desktop website.

This is downright the WORST airline app I’ve ever used, which is surprising because even the cheap airline tickets I’ve bought had good apps.

AA, put a boarding pass link on EVERY page on your app! Add a freaking search feature at least!

This app is bad enough to make me consider never flying with AA again!
title: NOT user friendly!

review: In the mist of these difficult times everyone is stressed. American Airline is no different, yet you’ll never know it while on their flights. The staff gate agents and flight attendants have been a pleasure ti be with! Thanks for your service couldn’t donit without you!
title: Working Hard

review: I’ve used this app for many years and it has never failed me. It keeps me updated with changes to my flight, easy to review my reservation and also to make necessary changes as well. So far the best I used with any other airline.
title: The best

review: I have had an amazing experience with the American Airlines App! It gives me notifications when something changes and makes flying so much easier. I would recommend this app to anyone who fly's with this airline.
title: Very useful and reliable!

review: How, with a semi/empty plane, and a very light crowd at DFW, and arriving at the airport an hour before flight time, can American lose your bag on a direct flight to DULLES? Hard to imagine, but they did it. My bag was never even loaded in Dallas, and American is only 80% confident I’ll get it tonight. I wish my lifetime Platinum status and 3 million + miles were on another airline . . .
title: Lost bag

review:
1) location changes: I have four flights within the next week. I am continuously getting notifications for location changes. I’m not sure where the change is happening, but opening the app will trigger this, one notification for each flight. It will also happen randomly throughout the app, but four notifications are guaranteed when I open it. 

2) on boarding pass: I checked in, but it took several attempts to actually get my boarding pass to show up.
title: App Bugs

review: There are just so many things wrong with this application. The latest I found as I’m driving into the airport tonight is that because the aircraft took off yesterday at 8:45 and is landing today at 1:45 AM I am on able to look up the flight status either by the flight number or any other way. Because now that it is Saturday The application won’t allow me to look up a flight that took off on Friday night.
title: Not even sure where to start

review: As a regular traveling consultant, I'm actually satisfied with the app when it comes to useablity for traveling - I can change my seat/flight/etc with easy. But I HATE that Everytime I open the app it "updates" my calendar  notices for my upcoming flights. There is NOTHING to update and it's a very annoying "feature" to have banners for one flight after another. Please fix asap.
title: App good for travel but one huge bug

review:
Regular stressers:
- get packed, forget anything?
- get to airport early enough, traffic delays?
- get to gate, changed gates and run across airport?
- flight schedule, delays?
- flight schedule, cancellations?
- landing, no gate and stuck on tarmac?
- baggage carousel, no bag?!
- baggage carousel, damaged bag?

And now this app adds to it when you attempt to logon it refuses to complete and gives you:

“Security Alert”

“The security certificate presented
cannot be validated as belonging to
American. Please attempt to connect
to another network and restart the
application.”

Unreal. 

I’m going to have to get a paper boarding pass…  so add to the stressers:

- AA app, broke and no wallet boarding pass?
- AA app, broke, can’t get decent seat for cross country flight?
- Go to AA counter for paper boarding pass, long line make it to gate on time?
title: Travel is stressful enough… then this app

review:
The only thing that makes preparing for an international trip even more anxious is not being able to use your airline’s app!! American, fix your app that uses NFC for my passport!!!!!!! Where it wants me to enter my expiration date, it thinks I’m changing my birthday…. There isn’t 2 fields. After 2 hours to trying AA website (because gave up on the app) says I can’t check in and have to see a  gate agent. 

Rather pay more not to hassle with this next trip, American do better. 👎🏼
title: So frustrating

review: Trying to upgrade to first class and keep getting the error “our system is having trouble, please try again or come back later“. I call American and the representative cannot figure out what is wrong, I then talk to a manager who tells me it will be fixed within two hours. That was four days ago and it still is not fixed! I still cannot upgrade! Sigh :(
title: Upgrade NOT

review: Wonderful flight and good crew.  Arrived at DFW at 8:47.  Were at gate and off the plane before 9. Through Immigration in less then 5 minutes.  Waited at baggage claim for bags for awhile.  Got an announcement at 9:30 saying bags were off the plane and will be here shortly.  At 9:48 the bags finally came on the carousel.  That’s quite a long time since another plane arrived after us and those passengers got their bags 20 minutes before us.  Very disappointing.  Also cost us $15 more for an Uber because of the delay
title: Trip from Costa Rica to Dallas

review: I’ve been flying on AA a few times over the last 4 weeks, and no matter what I do, I can’t get the “free” movies or tv series to work... it’s sure costing me plenty of nerves. Live tv on their web site is working, but for movies it directs me to connecting with WiFi on the plane from their app, only to go back to the home screen... am I missing something? Or is American trying to keep the number of movie watchers down to not have complaints about how slow their WiFi is?
title: Movies not working on iPad

review:
Tried 3 times to check in and upgrade my seats today for a AmEx booked corporate travel. Get all the way to the end and a generic error message. Wait time for customer service, 1hr.

This is my least desired airline and with each negative experience, it’s pushing me towards flying Southwest. 

AA just can’t deliver a seamless check in and travel experience. Can’t do it. 

*****

AA needs to benchmark against UA, Alaska, Jet Blue - even Delta. The app let me try to check in, then let me get a preferred seat, enter all credit and address info - IN MY IPHONE - then say it can’t give me the seat until traveler is checked in. Impossible loop. So I go to app to complain. SO MUCH INFO required before I can give feedback. TYPING ON MY IPHONE - In Your IOS APP. Seriously get a user experience designer and test your app for impossible loops that frustrate your customers.
title: Not user friendly

review: Like any airlines, sometimes flights do get cancels for many reasons. After calling to speak with an agent, they accommodated me so I could be in Idaho as plan. They went à over and beyond to make it happen! Thank you to whoever helped me get to Boise Idaho today!
title: Flight change

review: Look I love American Airlines but I have to say a better off just signing in as a guest to check in. This is the clunkiest, most cluttered app ever!  And good luck trying to pay for your baggage online after you check in. There’s no tab! It shouldn’t be something I have to hunt and hunt to find. I’d be better off just using the regular website as a guest - at least that took no time at all. Now I’m going have to pay for my baggage at the airport, thank you very much. *sigh*
title: Most frustrating app ever!

review:
It comes across from the employees of American Airlines that they hate their customers. 

Tonight on flt 608 multiple announcements from the flight crew and the flight attendants berating people for standing up, not wearing masks properly, turning on the help button when the flight attendants were seated. 

It’s just not like that on other airlines. Southwest is sweet and friendly. So why is this? CULTURE. It comes from the top down. Remember boys and girls. Bottom-up management rules the future.
title: AA Culture

review: Inflight entertainment was down and we were not informed of it at the beginning of the flight . Second , there was no food for purchase and only one round of beverages. I usually love AA, but they really dropped the ball on this one . 4 hour flight while shorter than most , is long without access to basic amenities. Really disappointed
title: Inflight entertainment and food

review: Helpful and well-designed, happy I downloaded this. The in-flight entertainment is certainly enjoyable but all trip information within the app is quite valuable. Also impressed with operation and user experience.
title: Outstanding

review: They screwed me out of an extra $250 & I’m so not happy about. Don’t think I’ll be using this airline anymore & I’m gonna spread the word to all my entertainment friends & Fam to stay away frm American Airlines. The service is garbage & they take too long to get back to you to fix issues. On top of the plane ride out of LAX & bck to LAX was very cramped & they had no outlets to charge your devices. I mean if you’re going to charge the prices you charge at least have outlets for ppl to charge their electronic devices.
title: I Am Very Upset

review:
Apparently only multi city searches can be done from the actual website on a computer and not from an iPhone. 
Once you book a flight and go back to check the amenities but never tells you if there’s any meal service. You have to go back to the flight display search to see the details.
title: Multi city search

review: The app doesn’t seem to work on the lates apple iOS updates I think at least from 13.1 and onward. I opens and gets stuck on the scenery screen the after a few minutes shuts down.
title: iOS 13+ update issues

review: I was really treated well with the customer care from ticket reservations,luggage and flight check in and the actual flight,Flight attendants were excellent a true testament having Union members that really care for their customers and their job !!!
title: Great Service

review:
I open up the app to check my connection time while I’m sitting on the plane, and it immediately starts spamming Siri with 11 updates for events! (No exaggeration, I counted). And most of those are listings for updating more than one event! This is incredibly annoying and needs to be fixed.

I close the app - Another 8 alerts. I open the app again, another 6. I close the app and another 6.

That’s 31 alerts in under 3 minutes!!!!
title: Way too many calendar update alerts

review: If I want to do anything except look at flights it crashes -pls fix! I travel very frequently and purposely choose American, however this latest app update is horrible and of absolutely no use.  The other airlines I’ve flown in the past 8 weeks (7 others where American does not have service) have much more helpful apps for travelers. Pls fix this and then make some user friendly updates.
title: Constantly crashing- apparently my feedback from several weeks ago meant nothing to the developers.

review: Now that AA pushes using their app for online entertainment, I was surprised that on a recent flight, the app on my iPad just didn't seem to work right. I decided maybe it needed an update, even though it showed up to date. So I deleted it and tried to reload and now it says it won't download because it's not compatible with my iPad! I think it may be because my iPad does not have Siri as it's an original iPad mini. Come on AA- now I can't use your app on my iPad?  How come? So much for inflight entertainment!
title: Won't work with my iPad any longer

review: Flew from Mesa, AZ to Jacksonvile Beach, FL … flight attendants greeted the passengers with smiles and one attendant has some funny jokes … still no food yet  … just beverages and snacks … oh yeah, no mask issues from flight attendants and passengers … also had no flight cancellations or delays … the first leg of my flight came in 16 minutes early … 😊
title: Pleasant Flight

review: Cancelled my $287 trip within 48 hours, waited 20 days after submitting refund request to be told I’m ineligible to get my money back. Such theft makes me want to laugh. Airlines use tax payers money to fund airports, and offset millions by government subsidies and yet will steal your money from you the moment you pay them and you’re unable to go. This is unacceptable, I will use my credit and rest assured I will never fly this horrible representation of America. The America I know is good to it’s citizens 99% of the time.
title: Most unethical

review: AA has done a great job in improving the App to host all of the account, airport and flight information in a simple format. Many other easy to use tools to find information on Status, trip and seat details; and most importantly upgrades, right in one place, your app!
title: American Airlines App is excellent

review:
Wanted to simply change my return flight from Friday to Thursday, same connections, same times, same cities. 

They claim no change fees due to pandemic, but it was still about $200 additional cost and 2 hours on the chat and phone calls.  

The chat I had to wait about 40 minutes for the first reply.  Then after all the wait, I found out they could process payments and I still had to call. 

When I called, 60 minute wait time to take my money. And they didn’t understand how to take my money because I made the changes through the chat app.  They couldn’t assign seats either. 

SWA has always made it super easy and transparent to change on their app. AA could sure take some advice from them!
title: Can’t simply change flights. App Chat is a waste of time

review: Just flew from Sea to Fll with a stop in DFW. Overnight flight landing at 5 am in DFW. My flight was cancelled to FLL while I was enrolled and I had no message from AA to let me know it cancelled or I was being booked on next available flight. Nothing whatsoever for communication except on my boarding pass on my phone it said cancelled.  I had to scramble and call and find a flight in which I had to fly to MIA instead and then pay Uber to get me up to Fort Lauderdale.  Still not one word from AA about this.
title: Let me know next time

review: Could use some of the added features that some of the other airlines have in their apps but this does a great job of allowing me to book flights, change flights, change seats, or just about anything I need to make my travel day easier.
title: Overall Great app

review: This is usually a pretty reliable app from what I’ve experienced. Since the last update, however, the app does not appear to work and has “connection” issues on both WiFi and cellular data, hopefully they fix it soon since I travel again for work this week.
title: Broken Since Update

review: Tried booking an urgent flight this morning and the app would just freeze on me.  Made 5 attempts (even swipe killed the app each time) and all of them failed.  Finally, went to the United app and booked my flight there.  AA needs to do better on this app if they want to avoid losing sales to competitors.
title: Booking flights doesn’t work

review:
PLEASE add lap infant designation to mobile boarding passes when the passenger has notified the airline in advance!!! I am already traveling with a small child, why make me make an extra stop at the kiosk to also PRINT a pass?? Because yes, TSA May actually check. Because it’s their job. 

Otherwise I love using the app for the boarding pass, tracking my flight, etc.
title: ADD LAP INFANTS TO MOBILE PASS!

review:
This app used to be one of the best. But the recent updates have left it slow and made it annoying. 
Trying to update the info takes a long time, no matter how good or bad your connection may be. 
Opening seat maps takes way longer than it used to. 
The removal of the Admiral’s Club mobile check-in feature, if only temporary, shows poor planning on the developers part.  
Then it’s made even worse by the fact that the boarding passes in the wallet expire upon arrival, so there’s no quick way to access the club, unless you screenshot the boarding pass. 
But most annoying of all, is the constant bombardment of Siri notifications when you open the app!  And most of the time they are duplicates!!!
title: The Mighty Are Falling

review: The app was working fine until I tried to purchase seat upgrades. I tried several different seats and several different cards over the course of an hour. I got repeated errors stating my request could not be processed and to try again x 10. I finally called and could not get anyone over the phone to help with a seat upgrade. I'll try calling again later but was hoping to do this easily through the app.
title: Worked fine until I tried to pay for a seat upgrade

review: On two consecutive trips I attempted to change my seat to an improved available seat in the same cabin as my ticket but when it came time to pay with my credit card on file, the app simply reported an error and “try again later.” Needless to say I did not try again later. Some businesses just don’t want your money no matter how hard you try to spend it!
title: AA Must Not Want My Money

review: I am very happy the flight was smooth and safer. I normally don’t like back seats but this one was more comfortable. The biggest difference that made me offer 5 star is this flight attendant Emily. She was so understanding and made my trip most comfortable ever.
title: Fairly good customer service

review: 2020 has been a rough year for flights. I’ve had to cancel and reschedule but AA has been very helpful. I feel everyone using this airline should have this app especially service members and people who travel for work.
title: User Friendly

review:
PayPal payment does not work through this app because when you select PayPal , it opens PayPal payment in a browser window , then if you go through the process at the end it says unable to process because you're in a different browser. You have to start over 

So don't waste your time trying to pay with PayPal through this app.
title: PayPal payment is an option but doesn't work in app

review: We flew into the Charlotte area from DCA. The flight attendants were very professional and accommodating. We returned in today and American Airlines did not disappoint. Everyone wore mask which was comforting. I do wish that there was more social distancing on the plane. Overall I would recommend
title: Awesome Experience

username: The Player To Be Named Later
review: This app is serviceable but lacks capability and maneuverability compared to other airlines. If you are simply looking to just book a flight it is equivalent but if you are looking for detailed functionality for things such as account info it is very pedestrian.  Want to know how many EQM’s you are going to get for a segment?  Good luck finding that on the App.
title: Just OK compared to other airlines

review:
I’ve been using the AA app for a good long time now, and it is invaluable if you travel.

It has saved me a lot of grief over time with timely updates and notifications.

A big reason I fly American!
title: The AA app has saved my chicken more than once!

review:
I have been flying American for several years and the app has, for the most part, worked well. Since the last update, I can’t get my current segments, miles or current status. It jumps around from 8 segments to 60 segments. I have 122 currently. It also will not show any existing upcoming flights. 
Please fix this. I use the app on IPhone 7 & 5 and IPad.
title: Lost functionality with last update

review:
I mean you gotta feel sorry for a billion dollar company who puts worthless apps out like this - it’s clear they don’t care. Their executive team has their assistance do everything, so they obviously never use it.  

What would be worse is if their executive team actually did use it and believes it’s awesome - bahahahhahhaha, old rich executive have their heads crammed so far in the sand they are licking oil.

They should check out Delta’s, that thing is butter smooth.
title: Do they think this is 👍🏽 😂

review:
The background picture is pretty, and you can at least book a flight I suppose.  Even check in!  What you can’t do is manage anything else that goes with your trip. Very much a “we’ve got your money, so now we don’t care anymore” approach. Is it *really* that difficult to be able to manage your seat, or purchase a money/mileage upgrade from the app?  Only with American - you can call Aadvantage account a and leave a message for a callback in 2-3 hours. 

TL;DR App is useless. Don’t bother.
title: Worst of the major Airlines

review: Downloaded the app, decided to join an AAdvantage. As I completed filling out all my information and when clicked to “submit” nothing happened. In an attempt to fix it had to re-enter my birthday and then proceeded to click “submit,” at this point get a message saying “duplicate account.” Immediately decided to delete this app. Figured it would be horses#it even if I did try making another. Just hope you delete all my information from your database. Would like an email saying so. Thanks.
title: Zero Star

review: We had a flight booked at 6:40 a.m. We checked the app multiple times the night before, the last being at midnight. When we arrived at the airport, we were told our flight was canceled and moved to the next day. We were going to Belize for humanitarian work that was time sensitive. We received NO notification and had to pay for an uber from the airport back home. VERY disappointed in this app and the airline. We all had notifications on and received NONE.
title: Where was my notification?

review: This app is really making progress. It has prioritized the top features and functions you want for managing your travel arrangements. Has a secondary features to still provide, but I found it to be quite useful and responsive when a canceled flight nearly killed my whole plans.
title: Making progress.

review:
I have flown with many different airlines. I have been flying only American for over 2 years now because of service . And comfortable seating. Thanks for the work you put into making my flights with you over the top.
Audrey
title: Excellent

review:
This has to be the most poorly designed app in the airline industry. The screens are cluttered. Everything one needs to do in the course of a trip is hidden or several actions away. The feature prioritization is horrible. Perhaps the worst user experience I’ve ever encountered. 

Your old apps were so much easier to use. 

AA: If your team didn’t spend cash on usability testing, you should. If they did, you should get your money back.
title: Unnavigable and useless. Profoundly unintuitive.

review: The app is amazing. Features and functionality that is faster than the automated phone calls or the board updates in the airport. Frequently know what’s going on before the check in desk does. Couldn’t be happier with American or the App.
title: Great App for a Great Airline

review: Overall the app is good but I really hate how randomly it will tell you the boarding time but then it will revert to departure time randomly. It would be nice if the app showed your boarding time the entire time so you can be clear of exactly when you need to be at your gate.
title: Boarding / departure time

review: For the last 2-3 months, the iPad app starts, but shows nothing on the left side menu area.  Therefore, I can’t do anything with it.  The only thing that shows up is their credit card offer (of course).  I have deleted it, restarted, cleared settings, etc. and nothing fixes the issue.  It works fine on iPhone, but very tough to use the entertainment capability on such a small screen.
title: IPad App Not Working

review: I want to say that it is so good to be back flying with American. They do what they have to do and they do it the best of anyone. I am about to finally get back to my Executive Status after being away from it for a few years. That says it all.
title: Best in the Air

review: Very impressed with flights and wheel chair attendants were so personable! The highlight of our trip was the flight attendant on the grand island flight, Shawn. Great personality and sense of humor, she made the flight enjoyable. The pilots on the gi flight handled a very windy day excellent also!
title: Very please with our trip!

review: This app is no longer working on my iPad, even though I’ve reinstalled it several times and even restarted my iPad with no other apps opened up in the background. The background screen loads up, but nothing else, and after a bit the app crashes. Not sure if it’s just me, but adding my two cents in case others are having this problem.
title: Not working on iPad

review: First flight on American, was very impressed. Thank you!!! Felix flight attendant in business class, excellent! Flying home to ny on 19th, will be my husband’s first experience too. I wish business class was available for us both. Thank you again!
title: Therese Bradeen

review: I travel 250k miles a year on various airlines. The AA app. is hands down the best one out there. Very intuitive and easy to use. Anything you do on the website can be done on the app. No other airline has that much functionality.
title: Best Airline App!

review: The app becomes useless, when it has to support information on a partner airline for which they sold you a ticket; which is done all the time. They have their AA flight number, which will never appear on any airport board because, it isn’t an AA flight. To add insult, the app knows and tells you that it is a flight on another airline but, doesn’t provide a flight number. Not a well integrated piece of software at all.
title: No app would be better

review: Booked a flight on the app today, all seemed well until I went to send the flight details to a friend. Our tickets were gone. Upon reaching out to customer service they said their “system” crashed and offered to rebook us a ticket at 5 times the price (not exaggerating). We had made additional flight plans out of the country based off of the AA tickets and now we are missing our next flight. DO NOT USE. System will “crash”
title: Do not use!!

review: If someone's gift card or payment doesn't go through for some reason you should alert the person through the app. Email is not always the most effective way but getting an alert on your phone would be super helpful.
title: Alerts

review: For whatever reason, the iPad app wants to take you to Safari in  order to book a ticket; super frustrating! Why one cannot book tickets through the app itself on an iPad is dumbfounding. After taking me to Safari I’m now required to login/re-login which again is another pain! Either use the iPhone app or go direct to the website, do not bother downloading this app if you plan on using it on an iPad.
title: iPad app unable to book/redirects to Safari

review: My trip to durango Colorado was such a disappointment too many things went wrong -I ended up not even flying in to Durango went to Denver to keep from losing anymore vacation time since our flight was diverted the hotel they put me in was extremely bad they kept giving keys to rooms that were already occupied they gave me one voucher for taxi but morning time comes around and I had to pay to get back to airport ...very disappointed
title: American Airlines disappointment

review: Works for checking in and looking at flight info, but the main reason I downloaded the app rather than using the website was so I could get the mobile boarding pass. But because one person cancelled on the trip, and not all passengers are checked in. Nope. Can’t do it. Guess I’ll just waste time at the airport picking up my pass for pretty much a stupid reason
title: It’s fine

review: I would have given no stars if I could. Stop advertising your credit cards, I ALREADY AM a card holder, I and use it every day. The frustration this lousy website has caused us immeasurable. Also, exactly how much money do I have to spend on this card to get a bump in status? It’s the most aggravating! If Southwest Airlines would, once again, have direct flights from Ft. Myers, I would drop AA in a New York minute. Southwest has a much easier boarding system, and much easier to EARN a free flight. So disappointing! Fix it fast.
title: The WORST

review:
Limited in functionalities compared to Delta and United.

Multiple taps to screens to look at your flight information. To connection/airport map. You can’t see upgrade or standby lists.  

To see your profile, wallet, itinerary, status, and to purchase in-flight add-ons requires multiple taps, pulling things up/down on the screen.

Did I say a lot of taps just to see any type of information?

And I really don’t care for the credit card advertisement, a waste of screen real estate.

Slightly different feedback, their aircrafts and service are lacking compared to Delta. They short change on the premier class’ leg room and recline. Also they don’t do a good controlling cabin temperature, even after asking on a frigid cross Atlantic flight. Flight attendants are rude. I honestly wouldn’t fly them unless I have to.
title: Meeh, lacking

review: I try to login and it says my account can’t be found. I try to register and it says there’s a duplicate account. I try to contact customer service for help and it sends me to a non-searchable FAQ page. On top of that, when booking flights it doesn’t tell you the state or country, just the city name. I booked for San Jose, Costa Rica and was sent to San Jose, California. Now, I’m trying to get new tickets and I’m unable to login or retrieve a password. Very frustrating.
title: Horrible app and horrible service

review:
App has problems almost everyday of some type , for instance right now it says my planes is leaving Dallas at 151pm and has arrived in Pensacola at 128pm at gate 5. , what a disaster and a joke. 

Customer service is terrible as I just asked for a bag tag and not only got a red tag but a lot of attitude from the gate attendant when I asked for a priority tag. Stated red was all that he had. 

We are not paying customers and truly not appreciated
title: The App is terrible and so is the customer service at American Airlines

review: This app is awful. Anyone who has rated better then 3 stars - go dl United’s app and you will change ur mind. The AA app is not easy to navigate, does not include all features it needs and is borderline worthless. I actually prefer just going to the website which is super inconvenient but atleast I get the features I need...sometimes. This is a “top” airline and the app should reflect that. It does not as of today. AA please invest some time and money to make this better.
title: Not user friendly

review: What a well constructed, easy to use app. Most helpful tool provided by any airline. Has airport maps, shows when and where you will leave and arrive, and all information is accurate/instant.
title: Absolutely Love It!

review: I was not born in the U.S. However, I am proud now to say I am American. U.S. is the land of opportunity and choose to only fly American. The airline thinks of me first, from membership miles, to travel perks. My daughter from birth is accumulating miles. Thank you AA
title: It is not transportation it is a way of life

review: It’s expensive to travel. When you spend as much money as we all do while traveling we expect to be treated with respect. The staff at American Airlines is consistently rude and disrespectful. I don’t understand why people cannot be more courteous and understanding. The staff treat you like you did something wrong while dealing with you from first interaction. It’s comparative to being pulled over in a traffic stop. Airline employees are on a power trip these days!
title: Staff on a power trip

review: Downloaded the app to make things easier for our trip and I must say this app wasn't it. I went to go check in on here and it gave me a message that said  there are many people that have the same number. We can't tell which one is yours. Call customer service for help. I guess if your traveling alone or maybe two people its probably good. But for me traveling with a family the app wasn't worth Downloading
title: Wasn't worth downloading for me

review: Raised my boarding pass at airport to be sure app worked. It did!  Got to the TSA line, confident. Ya, right. The app promptly crashed. The TSA agent, very helpful gave me a good 5 minutes to fiddle with this crummy app. It never did work. I had to go out and get a paper boarding pass. There is no excuse for peddling deficient apps like this one. There are plenty of competent programmers who can get this going. AA: fire your app developer and try another, maybe a kid who can set up a useable application!
title: This is 2021 and app still crashes

review: During my last 3 flights, the airline has misplaced my bags for 2 days and made me check in on carryon bag on two different flights that I’ve never had to check in during at least 30 other flights.
title: Lost bags and checked carryons

review:
I downloaded the app to keep track of the ever changing changes to my itinerary 
Can’t even get past putting in my name 
It sticks and crashes.  Maybe it’s just malfunctioning today. But some notice of such would be nice.   I’m amending this review 
After several attempts to use the app ( and several delete and reinstall)  it seems the latest is still fixings bugs !  Seriously?! For a year?!
I’ll never fly aa again. Worst app worst airline
title: Terrible. Non functional

review:
The application was working fine for a while and in these recent updates it doesn’t allow me to sign in using my credentials.

I used the exact same credentials online (on a computer) and it logged me in without any issues. And yes I have double checked the spelling. This takes the usefulness out of having the application. In my case anyway.
title: App won’t allow me to sign-in anymore!

review: I use the app weekly in my travels and it was great until a couple of weeks ago when on my iPad Pro the flight details on the right side of the screen are cut off and overlapping other text. This needs to be fixed!
title: Font issues

review:
I am not a frequent flyer with lots of complicated demands. For me this app does everything I need. It gives me updates on my flight and my bags. It has entertainment choices. It has terminal maps. It even gives me the traffic to the airport. It’s made
My travels much easier.
title: Works great for me

review: The system needs a way have passengers fix issues when suffix is on passport but the flight system does not have suffix, which does not allow Che kin through the app.
title: Name mismatch error off of International flights

review: Compared to JetBlue and United, American’s mobile app is terrible. It’s lacking basic features and I’m unable to do anything within the app, for something as simple as changing my seat I’m redirected to their website which never actually loads via the app. For the past 5 years I receive the same error message when trying to view my AAdvantage account. A mobile experience is such a simple but important aspect of flying and American totally fails here.
title: The worst mobile app out of all airlines

review: When the app works, it does when it needs to do. But they must release updates without actually checking if it works, because every other update it loses functionality in one way or another. Super frustrating when you only notice as you’re trying to pull up your trip. Get better devs, AA. Or at least test your updates before releasing, seriously.
title: Buggy as heck but you’re kinda stuck with it

review: Our first flight got canceled, so we rebooked from a different airport- and drove 2 hours. Flew to Dallas, found out our 2nd flight got canceled. In Dallas at 10:00am and they can’t find a flight until tomorrow. So now we have to fly 2 more times to get to our destination tomorrow. Plus now American booked a hotel that isn’t near the Dallas airport, so now we have to Uber. And to top it off, you gave  us $12 for meal reimbursement.  All because they had no staff.
title: 2 Flights canceled in 1 day

review: Customer service has gone to the birds.  Current average wait times on the phone are 4 hours.  When you go on the app to change your flight, it lets you put all your information in, credit card number, everything. Then when its time to complete, the finish button is covered up!!! The bottom of the app has seat change buttons and they cover up the Finish button. Terrible design.
title: crap app

review: The app prevents you from checking in or getting your boarding pass for an international flight - it prompts you to download another third party app and upload covid documents but even once you do that or if you choose to instead present your covid documents in person, either way, it doesn’t let you check in ahead of time. So you still have to go to agent at the airport
title: No longer usable to check in for intl flights

review: I love the app and probably use it at least twice a day. It provides me live updates, it’s easy to book flights, move flights and cancel flights without having to call anybody. I also love that I can use it on the plane to watch movies, TV or music.
title: Great app

review: iPhone App will only show boarding pass in Apple Wallet. But it won’t update even with the auto-update setting on. Gate agent said our equipment changed and we should update our boarding passes. Since mine wouldn’t update I deleted it from Apple Wallet. But the AA app would not send a new pass to Apple Wallet! The gate agent had to print them for me. What a terrible experience. AA app should have an option to display boarding pass in the app.
title: Bugs: bad boarding pass sync w Apple Wallet

review: As a company if you want to enforce masks you should make sure everybody is on the same page and follows the same rules. I see some of your employees all over passengers about masks but on the other hand I see your employees have their masks below their nose... also your employees who work in the field / tarmacs with just the neck gaiters walking around inside the airport. Double standards never work and create a lot of issues.
title: Masks

review: Stop using notifications for spamming me about your latest deals. Send that stuff through email. Nobody wants or needs to see it on an app. It is especially scummy because you still need to have notifications enabled for actual alerts, like if there’s a gate change or some other thing that is ACTUALLY important. Spam is nowhere near important enough to justify interrupting other things I’m doing.
title: Stop using notifications for spam

review: I think Sam is very savvy in his review of the application, but I still rate the app as workable and the airline my favorite for its great people. After 3 million miles, I fly less and rarely get to fly my favorite airline, but I really appreciate that they fly to my new hometown of Oaxaca with connections to my Texas family.
title: Still Great People

review:
My review is of another review.  'Stewbinator' wrote an awesome review, basically saying everything I wanted to say.  But everything from proper spelling, use of commas, and calling out criticisms of the app as silly made it so much better.

Everyone, when writing a review, be like Stewbinator.
title: Stewbinator is awesome

review:
Search for flights looks very much like a web browser in a window, results are formatted poorly . The designers should really take a look at the kayak app. Useful to view an already booked flight

When checking in, if there is an error, provide the reason, not just a “there is an error”

Input boxes for passport date exports have infuriating validation mid selection
title: Lazy design, poor usability

review:
Live flying American but today I have comments. At JFK there should be more attendants at the bag drop. The line is too long  Also for priority customers there should be a separate bag drop line
   It took forever for luggage to come off the plane. We landed at 11:03 and the first bag came down at 11:38.  Can’t fathom why it should take a half hour.
title: Some issues today

review: Hello! This was my first time doing a connecting flight. I liked how there was a map of the other airport. I also liked how the app kept up to date with the flight and boarding mminfo
title: First time with connecting flights

review: Making flight bookings including using miles, boarding passes, flight info, even tracking baggage is all easy with this app. Best app!! Updates are fairly fast although sometimes there’s a lag but not for critical items.
title: Very reliable, awesome app

review: It kept my first flight on my screen and it wouldn’t update to my connecting flight. I deleted it from my wallet, went back to the app and it wouldnt let me re-download my ticket. Now I’m stuck in Arizona and have to ask customer service to print out a ticket for me. However, customer service is no where to be found. Big surprise. I swear when we have a convenient flying service we will have flying cars and airlines are trying to compete. This is garbage.
title: Doesn’t work well

review: It would be much more helpful if American Airlines would actually tell you when a flight is delayed rather than waiting right up until the actual time of the flight and then delaying and or canceling it. No such thing as customer service which matches the rest of the airline
title: Dishonest info

review:
I have no idea how this app gets 4.6 stars. Terrible app. 
1) Does not do auto fill on iPhones. 
2) If you want to use a partner carrier FF number, it forces you to delete all data. Ridiculous. 
3) Past ticket credit using old ticket number almost never works. 
4) Credit card input page is buggy. Not intuitive at all. Can’t pull up old saved cards and won’t let you save new cards saying old card exists. 
5) 500 mile upgrade option is has no input requirement but still pops up as if we need to do something about it. 

Shameful for one of the largest carrier in the world. Developers should learn from AS, DL or even small European carriers have better apps.
title: Worst US airline app

review:
Raegan National Airport AA Check-in process was absolutely lacking enough personnel and I accidentally was able
To ge to the gate on time - You must do something about that as I should not have to arrive at the airport 3 hours prior to a domestic flight in order to get to the gate on time  - way sub par!
In flight Wi-Fi did not work the entire flight - frustrating
title: Ivan’s Trip

review: I would have given a better score due to the flight attendants and pilots as they were very nice and accommodating. Unfortunately my bag was left in Dallas, when all the other passengers got theirs. Fort Wayne airport there was no one at the desk for at least 10 minutes to help us figure it out. We had to bang on the counter and call out to even have someone know we were there.
title: Baggage

review: Please add paying with Apple Pay for flights online and in the mobile app not just for paying for baggage. Please also add the ability to if you pay for main cabin extra you should get a checked bag included for the price you are paying for the main cabin extra. The app also constantly freezes when trying to book flights.
title: Add Apple Pay

review: After waking up at 3 am to get to our morning flight we found out the plane had mechanical issues. We had to deplane and got delayed till 10:30 then till 1:00 then till 4:30. Obviously missing our international connection but American Airlines only concern was making their next flight in that gate on time and completely disregarding ours. Thanks, not ever booking with them again, and I’d recommend you do the same.
title: What’s done is done

review: Allows me to book flights, view my upcoming flights, check in easily, keep track of my boarding pass, gate changes, and delays, and even track my bags. In other words: it does everything I’d want an app for my airline to do.
title: Excellent App

review:
This is one of the most confounding, frustrating apps I’ve ever used. The design Feels random to the point of manic. 

Controls are all over the place, buttons and CTAs are spread everywhere without any consistent design language. You’ve decided to use non standard menu systems such as the very strange slide up contextual menu with both buttons and text menu options. 

I can't imagine how much effort it must be to maintain this completely custom UI that none of your users will have ever seen before in any other app. 

Do you track how many users get lost searching for things in the app? 

Please redesign this app interface and do user focus group testing before launching. Use common UI elements and flows. Stop trying to reinvent user interfaces. It's not working.
title: User interface design anyone?

review: Very frustrating experience with this app when trying to upgrade seats. Selected seats, paid for upgrade, processed through my bank. Day later, no upgraded seats. They took my money but said they had no receipt. Now left having to dispute charge and a huge waste of my time. Something so simple is made completely frustrating. Try calling AA to fix the issue....huge waste of time.
title: Upgrading seats on app frustrating

review: I use the App regularly. Love the simple interface, notifies me to check in, let’s me add the boarding passes to my wallet, notifies any changes to my itinerary, shows me my upgrades and a whole lot of information to make my travel smooth. Keep it light and continue to focus on the most used features.
title: A good travel companion

review: This app doesn’t update properly your upcoming trips. It makes it difficult to trust it. The website has the flights changed while the app still has errors updating. Can you please fix that?
title: 5 stars, but...

review: Good app but push notifications are non existent at times. I should be getting push notifications when flights are delayed I shouldn’t need to refresh to see my flight is delayed. A little slow when loading data on the app definitely needs to be faster.
title: Meh it’s okay

review: Scanning your passport doesn’t work. It then locks you out so you have to go to the airport to check in. This happened to my wife two years ago, and it happened to me today. Garbage app. By the way, after you spend 1/2 an hour with customer service on a call if you can even get through they’ll let you know they can’t help.
title: Do not scan your passport

review: The problem with this app is that it fails at crucial and simple tasks, like checking in. With the pandemic and need for testing it supposedly is linked up with VeriFLY but even after validation of your test info the AA app will still not check in. Or it just fails altogether. It’s pretty good for monitoring your luggage and airport maps. For everything else it’s mediocre or just plain bad. Good luck.
title: A lousy app with a few bright spots

review: I wish they’d let you alter flights online. Especially since they keep changing my flight! Every time I call it’s a 4 hour or more wait time. I did the call back and they called 15 hours later! Not only that, I’ve been on hold 50 min and counting from my 15 hour later call back. 🤯 Southwest is the way to go!! You can make any changes online. No need to waste your life away on hold with American.
title: Terrible customer service

review: Spent 20 minutes on their website trying to fix a cancelled flight to which it says you can change and manage flights on their app. The app page is LITERALLY a copy and posts of the same web page which doesn’t allow you to do anything but cancel your already cancelled flight. 2 hour wait on line, but oh bo I’m sure glad they rebooked my flight that didn’t have any issues and left me in DFW.
title: Worthless

review: The app lacks many features that other airlines offer such as being able to view open first class seats when awaiting an upgrade. It needs to be a little more polished.
title: AA app

review: “System error” almost every button you click. Actually extremely dangerous for travelers who depend on this working. I missed important updates, couldn’t check into my flights, couldn’t change seats, the app is very slow, and 8/10 times you click on a link in the app it’ll show an error. Do yourself a favor and stick with the browser website or just call them.
title: A joke of an app that almost never works correctly

review: I canceled a flight I brought for a friend and I. Even though I paid for the ticket with my airline credit card, apparently the credit is given to the other person. That concept is ridiculous and unfair. If you buy someone anything else and return it, your refund/credit isn’t given to that person, it goes back to your card. How am I supposed to know these things? It’s not like they give you a manual. It’s really unfair to customers.
title: I strongly dislike American Airlines!!!

review: Hello, please make a feature in the app to send a notification push or email when it’s time to leave for the airport. A warning could be send out two hours before the flight boarding. That would make this app a lot better!
title: Feature add - It is getting better.

review: My flight was canceled and rescheduled 2 times because of the storm in Denver, and the rescheduled flights took me all over the US. I went to the ticket counter at Phoenix and Timothy King got me on a direct flight so I could finally go back home. Thanks Timothy!!
title: PHX you rock.

review: i have a flight here in a few days so I downloaded the app to check my flight and so I could check in easier the only problem is it’s giving me all these options except for checking in I had bought the ticket through priceline can someone help ??
title: question?

review: An otherwise decent app is ruined by a broken  Siri suggestions implementation. Every time you open the app there are Siri suggestions to update all future flight in the Calendar app. This happens whether there are actually changes to your flight information or not. You have to manually clear these updates on every device that shares the calendar.
title: Broken Siri suggestions make app almost unusable

review: It does it’s job for the most part but when I logged into the the app on the flight the app was not working. It always says error 212 and guess what zero entertainment for the end tier 6 hours to by destination. Now maybe this is just bad luck. But still I could not really review the app do to the issue
title: Just okay

review: You have not upgraded the app to be compatible with IOS version 15.0.2.  As a result on my flight on Nov 4th, I was unable to view any videos on my flight.  I know this is the problem because my husband’s version on his Ipad is a earlier IOS version and he had no problem.  I see you did an upgrade on 10/29.  You need to do another one, soon please.  I fly back on Nov 11th and I’d really like to use the in flight entertainment.
title: Please Upgrade!

review: When you’re a much larger company putting out an inferior product compared to Spirit and Allegiant, there’s an issue. The app is a pain to navigate. It doesn’t update once you’ve checked in. You have to dig for information on baggage. The “record locator” number is nowhere to be found, you have to get it out of an email. It often logs you out in the middle of making a change or payment. Do better, American.
title: Lacking

review: I regularly use the sort option when searching flights in the app but it seems to have disappeared yesterday. Please bring it back!
title: Where did the sort option go?

review: I fly 3 weeks per month and use the AA website constantly. I get up to the minute seat availability; Admiral lounge locations; flight and upgrade updates, etc. Great to be able to access all of this on my phone.
title: Great Site for a Frequent Business Traveler

review: I’ve attempted 4 times to purchase tickets and it never goes through. Then the seats I picked prior are locked and not available when I re-try so I have to wait between tries. I’ve been trying for 2 days. If I could get them to answer the phone I would have done it over the phone. The app is useless for purchasing tickets it seems.
title: Frustrating!

review: I’m sooo tired of these apps that are supposed to be a useful tool for travel, now becoming barely anything more than a platform to promote their credit card crap, and not allow you to delete the ads. I travel a lot and find this airline is third rate at best, and as Un-American as you can get...unless your idea of “American” being the corporate giants charging exorbitant bag fees ($210 for 3 bags) and higher than necessary ticket prices. Not impressed with app or airline.
title: Fed up!!!

review: Would be great if there was a share feature so I could send my flight info to people directly from the app via text
title: New feature recommendations

review:
No Apple Pay support? Switching to another app erases any progress? No FaceID support? There was a time these weren’t important and that’s because everyone was carrying a blackberry. People want to use Apple Card to pay for flights. Make it easier to take my money! Do better!

App worked to book my flight but took almost an hour and a pad of paper with a pen. Like a farmer.
title: It’s 2022. Do better

review:
American Airlines just unceremoniously cancelled our flight along with hundred if others’ flights without warning.  We are currently stuck in DFW waiting in a loooong line to speak to customer service.

The American Airlines app scheduling function doesn’t have any open flights until tomorrow.  This is completely unacceptable.  Reservations are made so that a seat will be reserved on a plane at a given time.

If this is a staffing issue (I do not yet know if it is), American Airlines should have cancelled earlier today so we could make other arrangements.  

Meanwhile, I’ve been on hold with American Airlines’ customer service for 20 minutes while I stand in line waiting to speak to a rep in person.

Unbelievable!  Never again.
title: Horrible.

review: Out of 7 flights this year I have over 20 hours of delays. I have one emergency and need to change flights and they charge $150. Understand the charge if they ram on time more often or if they comped a checked bag. All risk no reward with this airline. 3 times have had to sleep in airport on a business trip because delays have pushed me passed business hours of my rental pick up. Not a drink 10% off or free checked bag. Delta here I come.
title: Bad airline.

review:
They do not give you drinks or snacks and claim “SD” as the reason. They make you wear a face mask the entire flight and separate while boarding.  Attendees will no longer help put your luggage overhead if you are unable so the kindness of strangers prevails, then they pack you in like sardines next to people you don’t know. 

They make an announcement that if you have problems with SD you can switch seats but when you ask to switch to an empty seat, they claim it’s a premium seat and costs extra—-as much as $100 just to move. 

Boo American Airlines. 

Tell me again why you can’t be served a drink on the plane?
title: So much for social distancing...

review: If you’ve been on a few flights with American you get used to certain things. These things include (but are not limited to): lost baggage, flight delays, missing flights do to delays, cancelled flights, and of course they don’t help with any of these afterward. So, as you can expect the all is much the same way. Nothing on the app actually works. I’m not exaggerating. It takes real effort to make an app like this where no functions of the app work.
