review: I downloaded the app to both my devices. Tried to watch a movie but first it was taking forever to load the movies, then when I tried to watch a movie it gave no option to actually watch it. I thought I was doing something wrong since this was my first time using the app and also first time flying American. I had 3 very nice and helpful crew members who tried to help me but they couldn’t figure it out either. After one of them told me to clear my browser and cache...well it got worse. I was not even able to go to the WiFi/entertainment page in the app ...it came up with a warning that this site is not secure and that it may be a fake website...lol. So no movies for the 5 1/2 hour flight. Then unfortunately it still gets worse lol. When we landed I was not able to access any websites from my favorites. I had to go to the safe travels website to get my QR code but when I clicked on it it came up with that same warning and would not let me go there! I restarted phone, I cleared the cache and still it wouldn’t let me go there. My husband suggest deleting the American Airlines app, saying he heard it was a crappy app...I’m like that’s not it...but I tried anyway and guess what...? That WAS it! I was finally able to access the safe travels website and get my QR code. App needs to be fixed or totally redone or something. I’ve used United’s app for inflight entertainment  many times with zero problems.
title: Doesn’t work

review: I was returning from Dayton to Baton Rouge via Charlotte. I was accompanying a friend who had a procedure on his brain 5 days prior to the flight. We were delayed in Dayton for a non weather related issue. Flight 5227. When we finally got to Charlotte we could see our connecting flight 5132 in the next port to us. However a notice was up saying boarding closed. Just 5 minutes more and we could have boarded or they could have let us off first. He was transported to the flight via wheelchair. We had waited much longer than that in Dayton. We then had to go by all the way to customer service.  Continue to bear in mind my companion had received a brain procedure in less than a week prior. We were then rescheduled for flight 5212 departing @ 10:15. That flight was again delayed. We spent approximately 8 hours in the airport. This could have been avoided by a plane waiting just 5 minutes. I am sure the airlines must track customers and the must have known the situation.  I am requesting  a refund for myself and my companion. Additionally COVID precautions where constantly being announced. I  have pictures of the lobby of people in very close proximity who were probably waiting for flights that were also delayed. Additionally I feel that there were probably fire code regulations violated. Please contact me ASAP. I would prefer a phone call. 1-225-485-0978
title: American Airlines flight management in Charlotte, NC.

And the app still won’t let me in. Such a frustrating experience!

review:
Delayed 2 hrs because of fog. Get to Charlotte. Misses connecting flight. 2 HOUR wait in Customer Service line. Finally get there. Nothing available for rest of day. Gotta spend the night.  No sorry. No help with that...physically or financially.   ... NEXT!

Rebook flight for next day, but now COVID test 6 days old, not required 5.  I am told at gate I will have to refill out portal form plus upload test results again. Plane boarding.  Finally someone tells the gate lady that our t st is Ok and we are allowed to board. 

Plane leaves and I get to my destination 24 hours late from original time. 

Then 24 hrs before return flight, I see THAT flight delayed thus missing my connecting flight AGAIN!. American has automatically placed me on a later flight back home. One hour after that I receive a voicemail message from American saying that my flight is now on time and to call them. I called them one hour later and the lady again tells me the flight has been delayed. I amSo confused.Flight continues overnight to show it is on time. I call the morning of the flight and I am told the flight is on time. I change back to the original connecting flight so I am able to get home sooner and it all works out after that. I have never dealt with the airline that communication is so messed up and then having my chain yanked every which Way but loose.

 I will NEVER fly American again.
title: Worst airline trip ever!!!

 Out of all the times I fly American Airlines 75% of the time the flight gets canceled or they leave us in a connecting flight.Our flight out of Lubbock  Texas had mechanical problems which placed us  at DFW five minutes before our connecting flight was to leave to Mexico. All the passengers were gracious enough to let us get out of the flight and run to the next gate and we are at the next gate one minute after it was scheduled to fly out. How is this  even possible. They knew that we had a delay leaving our  initial City and all the connections knew that but they couldn’t wait five minutes.

Can you imagine doing an 800 yard sprint  with the a mask on and everybody was just so uncaring.

My guess is people are paying the higher rates and not realizing it, so AA is not fixing it. Do not book through the app without checking AA.com to make sure the flight is the same cost. They have the rate on the App called Main Cabin Fully flexible which is the $1200 with Main Cabin Flexible “not available” and AA.com has the Main Cabin rate for $273. Every flight I have looked up as been like this. The difference in first class ticket for this flight was $1000 between the app and AA.com as well.

title: Okay but has flaws, limitations

review:
Well, it’s that time again, folks! Apple has fouled up something on their iTunes App Store servers, and so those of us who are still using iTunes 12.6.5 for Enterprise iOS device support and management are unable to (1) download new purchases from the store, and (2) update existing apps. When you clock the “download” button in the App Store, you see a message “Downloading …” but nothing happens and no error message appears. Similarly, if you click the “update” button on an app update, or the “Update All Apps” button, you will see the same “Downloading …” messages, but nothing will actually download and you’ll see no error message to explain why. This happens for every single app in the app store and every single update shown in the iTMS app updates interface.

Maybe the Big Brains at Apple have chosen this particular moment to finally, silently cut off all iOS app download/update methods except those done via the iDevice’s individual App Store interfaces, making it impossible for IT managers to control app purchase/update rollouts across all of their devices in anything other than an anarchic, catch-as-catch-can fashion. Or maybe they’ve just bungled their backend app update servers, like they seem to do with increasing frequency throughout these last few years of continuing decay and cr*pification of Apple’s feeble Web Services offerings. As usual, Apple support aren’t listening to end-users who submit error reports for this issue, so the only recourse for us is to pass the buck by giving one-star reviews to every app update that’s affected, in the hopes that developers with money on the line and access to actual iTunes Technical Support (as opposed to the teenage babysitters assigned to deal with lowly end-users) can get the problem fixed sometime before the next ice age arrives.

As of 18:22 on Monday, 23 March 2020, this is the list of app updates I’ve found that exhibit this problem:

Acorns
American Airlines
AT&T Call Protect
BestParking
Blue Shield of California
CARR
DocuSign
DuckDuckGo
Cornell University’s eBird
Epocrates
Eventbrite
Fandango
Farmers Insurance
File Hub

Google Drive
Hulu
ibotta

Instagram

Microsoft OneDrive
Microsoft Outlook
MLB Ballpark

Pandora

Sync - Secure cloud storage
Ticketmaster

Yahoo Sports

17Track
title: iTMS App Store is broken YET AGAIN

review:
This app generally works well. The navigation can get confusing sometimes, even for someone who travels multiple times per week. 

My only major gripe is that the app doesn’t show anywhere when the flight boards until maybe a couple hours before the flight. I know that they typically board 30 minutes before departure, but it doesn’t say anywhere!

The android version shows it on the boarding pass. The paper boarding pass shows boarding time. Why not the iPhone app? This seems like a major oversight.
title: Doesn’t show boarding time?!

review:
Flight 497 from LAX today. Besides not telling us where to pick up our bags, they took 20 minutes to arrive.

This is not normal AA performance.

Björn Houston
J794860
title: Baggage claim  TOTALLY  messed up

review:
Conceptually, a good app. Functionally, it is a poor implementation! I wonder if a developer ever tried to book a flight using it, and had to go to another app or source on their phone to get details, such  as checking their calendar, looking up a phone number, DOB, email address, etc. I assume not, otherwise they wouldn’t have released this product. Every time you suspend it to look at another place to pull information, when you come back IT STARTS YOU ALL OVER AT THE BEGINNING OF THE SEARCH FUNCTION!!! That is UNACCEPTABLE! Then, when you get back to seat selection, the seats you just selected are now blocked, presumably because you previously selected them. You can’t select them again. Not even remotely OK! So, you can’t copy and paste anything because it makes you start over each time. 
Also, the phone number doesn’t allow you to copy and paste from the phone book, because it doesn’t accept the parens or dashes. Also does not accept the 5+4 zip code format.

There is no way to provide FEEDBACK, or to CHAT to ask questions.

This is a pathetic excuse for an app, from someone who out to know better! They must have put a high school sophomore intern on this to develop it...
title: Infuriating from iPhone

review: Buggy app that doesn’t routinely allow simple activities such as one click check in (or any check in).No.obvious way of  connecting to anyone useful. Didn’t provide ANY updates for my flight that was delayed 11 hours. Unfortunately, we have little choice with this continued lack of service as all airlines are as bad - no customer support when you need it.
title: Rarely works properly and was not there when I needed it

review: This app has never allowed me to log into my AA account with my username, so I would use it as a guest. Now, even with all the latest updates it just crashes immediately after opening. I even tried reinstalling. It’s always been a bad app but now it doesn’t even function. The fact that hardly any American Airlines has screens in the seat, not being able to watch entertainment through the app is incredibly frustrating and annoying for long cross country flights. This just adds to the list of unappealing qualities about this brand and company.

review:
Pros: As one who has had problems in the past with American, as far as the actual flight today, all was good. A little late leaving on my connection flight but only about 10 minutes.
Cons: On my main flight from Orlando to Dallas, the lady in front of me was watching a movie that was one F*** after another. Literally!! I know the argument that no one forced me to watch, and I only saw about 30 seconds, but the point is, American has no business making that trash available. There are young children that don’t need to think this is okay!! When society allows this, we are partially responsible for how our children act!

Fix please

review: The app is a reflection of Doug Parker and his management of the airline - antiquated and subpar and much closer to the LCC he had at USAir than a major carrier.  Any activities (changing a seat, meal preferences, etc) all direct to AA.com and are incredibly slow.  You cannot book multi-city trips. You can rarely see the upgrade list (until after midnight at the earliest, but usually only an hour or so before the flight). You can’t apply a system-wide upgrade without calling the reservation desk and speaking to an agent.  It is woefully behind the competition set and its biggest upgrade is a notice that boarding has started 2-5 minutes too late.
title: 5 years behind competitors

review:
AA really can improve customer satisfaction if can get bags out n 20min or less IS THAT POSSIBLE?

review:
Where should I start?

Mobile app doesn’t work
Over 2-hr wait time to talk to someone at the Exec Platinum desk
Systemwide upgrades never clear
Entertainment doesn’t work on 777-300ER (this has happened at least twice in the last 5 months on 10-hr flights)
Priority bags are never unloaded first
And while in general the flight attendants tend to be very nice, 2 out 10 give such attitude that they really must not like their jobs. 

I have been an Exec Platinum frequent flier for a number of years now and sadly will be taking my business elsewhere.

review:
Stupid app cause my AA account to be LOCKED OUT for too many password entry attempts. No idea HOW that happened since I logged into the app only once and it was set to stay logged in.
Here comes the Best Part. The stupid app never tells you that the account is locked out. It just gives some stupid, cryptic, “Data communication” error or some such nonsense where you have no clue why things are not working. What a joke. Utterly pathetic.

Flight was 2 hours late. Minutes from missing my cross country connection on last flight of the day and this stupid app stops working.
Only after I logged into AA.com ( while on the ground because, of course, the in flight WiFi for as.com doesn’t work either) did I find out the account was locked out.

Just pathetic all around. Great idea to lock out stupid Frequent Flyer accounts during peak travel stress moments. Frequent flyer account doesn’t need bank account level security features. Give me a break. It’s like they make an effort to find ways to piss people off.

1/16/2020 UPDATE: Half the time app has “connectivity issues” and will not retrieve flight information. So cant check in using the app. Pathetic.
title: Another exercise in what airlines do best: Piss people off.

I looked up what my username flyer miles no. is and password so I can put it in myself, and it still tells me that my password is incorrect. I cannot log in. I try contacting them and they require, guess what? A username and password to connect via email for customer service. I do NOT want to call in, I’m a millennial who prefers the convenience of a mobile app and or website. Update your system to the modern age and fix these bugs. I prefer my loyalty to a company that invests into the future instead of holding onto what was.

review: I just got off the phone with Louis at AA.com technical support. (I magically got disconnected from the first technical support person) When I explained that I could not log onto the app (multiple times over the past week), his only solution was to say that I had typed in my password incorrectly. Interesting that the password works at aa.com, but not in the app. My solution, just delete the app. Terrible app. Terrible customer service.
title: Poor Customer Service, Worse App

review:
This app just does not work. I have tried everything to log in and it still says my information is incorrect and that if I continue to try up to six times my account will be locked. Here are the things that have failed:

1. Simply typing in my username and password or my account number and password 

2. Writing my user name and password to a note, copying and pasting both into the American Airlines website to confirm that they are correct, then copying and pasting the same credentials from the same note into the app. Still rejected.

3. Changing my password on the website, confirming that the new password works to log me in on the website both on my phone and on my desktop computer, pasting this password into a document to ensure that I am not making a typo, then copying and pasting this password along with the user name that also is confirmed to work into the app. Still rejected.

4. Updating the app to the latest version and repeating the copy/paste credential loop. Still rejected. 

There’s no way that user error is contributing here (copy/paste confirms this). The something on the AA side of things isn’t working, either the app or their backend servers. I’m not locking my account so I’m done with this BS.

Edit: determined cause, but still deserves 1 star for poorly written backend. AA puts security limiting restrictions on passwords (no more than 16 chars) but doesn’t stop you from making a password that violates the limitation. The app does not allow long passwords but pasting into the website does. 

1 Star, bad security (linger passwords are more secure!) and poor implementation of their bad security.
title: Can’t log in (and yes I’m using the right credentials)

review: My last reservation to Italy was so bad. The flight was to leave at 10:45am and during the middle of the night I got a notice that my flight was leaving at 5:45am through Miami instead of Philadelphia. If I had not been up, I would have missed my first flight. Luckily my ride was accommodating. Then I got charged for two check-ons instead of the one I checked. On May 8 I was charged $60 on TK#:  0010289570523 and $59 on the same day $59 on TK#:  0010647761231. I was to meet my two cousins in Philadelphia. My cousin that flew from Wrightsville Beach NEVER received her luggage. We were gone from May 8-21!!!  We were airbnbing from Almalfi Coast to Florence to Venice. AA was not very customer friendly.
title: Italy Disaster
